stipulatio: <entryFree id="n45434" type="main" key="sti^pu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭpŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stipulor</etym>, jurid. t. t., <sense id="n45434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promise given on demand; an engagement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bargain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covenant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obligation</hi> (syn. pactum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:31" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulatio est verborum conceptio, quibus is qui interrogatur, daturum facturumve se, quod interrogatus est, respondet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulatio non potest confici, nisi utroque loquente, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:1 sq" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 45, 1, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacta, conventa, stipulationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:24:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 24, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ea pecunia ex stipulatione debeatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:21:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 21, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem stipulatione alligare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum stipulationes legeram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulationum et judiciorum formulas conponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 3:19" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 3, 19</bibl> pr.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 7, 1</bibl>: is contractus stipulationum sponsionum sponsalia, Serv. Suip. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:32:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 32, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stipulatiuncula: <entryFree id="n45435" type="hapax" key="sti^pu^la_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭpŭlātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>stipulatio</etym>, <sense id="n45435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insignificant promise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stipulation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 174</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stipulator: <entryFree id="n45436" type="main" key="sti^pu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭpŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>stipulor</etym>, jurid. t. t., <sense id="n45436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who demands a formal promise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">covenant</hi> (opp. promissor, the one who gives the promise); <hi rend="ital">a bargainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:10:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:41" default="NO">45, 1, 41</bibl> sq.; 45, 38, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 10, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stipulatus: <entryFree id="n45437" type="main" key="sti^pu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭpŭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, jurid. t. t., <sense id="n45437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="STIR" /> <hi rend="ital">promise formally demanded; a bargain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 12:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 12, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid adversus pactionem fiat, non ex stipulatu agitur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:94" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:4:116" default="NO">4, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:4" default="NO">45, 1, 4</bibl> sq.; 45, 1, 103 sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 7, 2 sq.</bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
stipulo: <entryFree id="n45438" type="main" key="sti^pu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭpŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (collat. form of stipulor), <sense id="n45438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to exact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bargain for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:11" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 11</bibl>: <foreign lang="greek">e)perwtw=</foreign>, stipulo, Gloss.; mostly <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: Suetonius autem passivo protulit in IIII. Pratorum, Laetoria, quae vetat minorem annis viginti quinque stipulari (<foreign lang="greek">e)perwta=sqai</foreign>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 8, 4, 21, p. 794</bibl> P.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 19, 149, p. 1164</bibl> ib.—<hi rend="ital">Part. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia stipulata (for promissa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 5, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stipulor: <entryFree id="n45439" type="main" key="sti^pu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭpŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (<sense id="n45439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> paragog. stipularier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 6, 14</bibl>), <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=182" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 182</bibl> Müll., kindr. with stips: qui pecuniam alligat, stipulari et restipulari; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: cum spondetur pecunia, stipulari dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=297" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 297</bibl></cit> Müll.—More prob. from unused <pos>adj.</pos> stipulus, firm, from root stip-; v. stipo</etym>, jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to demand a formal promise; to bargain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covenant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45439.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipularier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:6:14 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 6, 14 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:92 sq" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 92 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque stipulantur sic, Illas capras hodie recte esse et bibere posse habereque recte licere, haec spondesne?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si is, cui legatum est, stipulatus est id ipsum, quod legatum est, ut ea pecunia ex stipulatione debeatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:21:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 21, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum est, ut stipulatum se esse dicat. ... Stipulatus es? ubi? quo praesente? quis spopondisse me dicit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantumvis stipulare, et protinus accipe quod do,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>ask</tr>, <tr>demand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:165" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod stipulanti spoponderam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10 praef.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:7:3" default="NO">46, 7, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45439.2" n="II" level="1"> Sometimes transf., of him who gives the promise or pledges himself (for the usu. promittere), <hi rend="ital">to promise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pledge one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis usuras solverit, quas non erat stipulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6:26" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 6, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:4:7" default="NO">13, 4, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stipulus: <entryFree id="n45440" type="main" key="sti^pu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭpŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (old Lat.), <sense id="n45440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">firm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulum apud veteres firmum appellabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 3:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 7, § 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stiria: <entryFree id="n45441" type="main" key="sti_ri^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. stilla; Engl. tear</etym>, <sense id="n45441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a frozen drop; an ice-drop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ice-drop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">icicle</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 366</bibl>; so too <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 12, 32, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:37:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 37, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 327</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45442" type="main" key="Sti^ri^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stĭrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island near the coast of Cilicia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 35, § 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stiriacus: <entryFree id="n45443" type="hapax" key="sti_ri^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīrĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stiria</etym>, <sense id="n45443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">frozen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gutta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
stiricidium: <entryFree id="n45444" type="main" key="sti_ri^ci^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīrĭcĭdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>stiria-cado</etym>, <sense id="n45444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a falling of snow-flakes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a snowing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stiricidium quasi stillicidium, cum stillae concretae frigore cadunt. Stiria enim principale est, stilla deminutivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=345" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 345</bibl></cit> Müll.; so Cato <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=344" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 344</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stirpes: <entryFree id="n45445" type="main" key="stirpes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stirpes</orth>, v. stirps <sense id="n45445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
stirpesco: <entryFree id="n45446" type="hapax" key="stirpesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stirpesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n45446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [stirps], <hi rend="ital">to run to stalk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asparagus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 42, § 149</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stirpitus: <entryFree id="n45447" type="main" key="stirpi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stirpĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.; cf. radicitus from radix</etym>, <sense id="n45447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by the stalk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by the roots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">root and branch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock and stump</hi> (very rare). * </sense><sense id="n45447.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborem transferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:7:3:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 7, 3, § 4</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n45447.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbam forcipibus evellere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45447.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (for the usu. radicitus), <hi rend="ital">utterly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc errorem, quasi radicem malorum omnium, stirpitus extrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:38:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 38, 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stirps: <entryFree id="n45448" type="main" key="stirps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stirps</orth> (collat. form of the <case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">stir-pes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">stirpis</orth>, in the best MSS., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 13, 16</bibl>; v. Drak. ad locc.), <itype>pis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.; also <gen>m.</gen>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=313" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 313</bibl> Müll., and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 226, 32</bibl> (Ann. 184); Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 227, 2</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. 421), and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 85</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 40, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 379</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 208</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 770</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 781</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 26, 40, § 96</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl>) [root star-; cf. sternere; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">store/nnumi</foreign>; prop. that which extends or spreads]. <sense id="n45448.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the lower part of the trunk</hi> of plants, including the roots; <hi rend="ital">a stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stalk; a root</hi> (class. and very freq.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">radix): arborum altitudo nos delectat. radices stirpesque non item,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:43:147" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 43, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra stirpes amplexa alat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:33:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 33, 83</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 26</bibl>; 2, 47, 120; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 51, 127: ut tantum modo per stirpis alantur suas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 32, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceptrum in silvis imo de stirpe recisum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 208</bibl></cit>: harundo omnis ex unā stirpe numerosa, Plin. <cb n="STLE" /> 16, 36, 65, § <cit><quote lang="la">163: palmarum stirpibus ali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:38:section=99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 38, § 99</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">palmarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 50</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">131 (for which: radices palmarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 33</bibl></cit>, § 87); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lento in stirpe moratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:781" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 781</bibl></cit> (for which, just before: <cit><quote lang="la">lentā in radice): stirpes raptas volvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">validis amplexae stirpibus ulmos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic stirpes obruit arvo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domos avium cum stirpibus imis Eruit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 209</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of hair: vellere albos ab stirpe capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 25, 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:45" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hac nimiā licentiā, ut ex stirpe quādam, exsistere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 44, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45448.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45448.2" n="1" level="3"> Of vegetables. </sense><sense id="n45448.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrub</hi> (esp. freq. in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">stirpium naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum arborum et stirpium eadem paene natura sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 11, 33</bibl></cit>; so (with arbores) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:22:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 22, 55</bibl>; (with herbae) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:64:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 64, 161</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pati (terram) stirpium asperitate vastari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 39, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpes tenent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">internatas saxis stirpes et herbas vellentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45448.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A shoot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprout</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami stirpesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpem praecisum circumligato, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probatissimum genus stirpis deponere, i. e. malleolos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:5:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpem post annum praecidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpis committere ramis,</quote> <trans><tr>engraft</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1365</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45448.5" n="2" level="3"> Of persons. </sense><sense id="n45448.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A stem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">family</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lineage</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">genus, familia): ignoratio stirpis et generis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpis ac gentilitatis jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sunt ejusdem stirpis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: a stirpe supremo, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 226, 32</bibl> (Ann. v. 184 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">divinae stirpis Acestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 711</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Priami de stirpe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculis stirpe generatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:12:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 12, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc orti stirpe antiquissimā sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum sceleratorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab stirpe socius et amicus populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">unum relictum, stirpem genti Fabiae futurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n45448.7" n="b" level="4"> Like Engl. <hi rend="ital">scion</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">offspring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descendant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progeny</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; not in Cic.): stirps liberum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 16</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 317 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">liberum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis magnā de stirpe nepotum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:864" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 864</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirps et genus omne futurum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 622</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">en stirps et progenies tot consulum, tot dictatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpis virilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui stirpem ex sese domi relinquerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 8, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45448.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">source</hi>, <hi rend="ital">origin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foundation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">altae stirpes stultitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:6:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitionis stirpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 72, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 32, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā ex stirpe orirentur amicitiae cognationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi exquiratur usque ab stirpe auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum a stirpe repetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:12:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 12, 21</bibl></cit> Mos.: <cit><quote lang="la">repetam stirpem juris a naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirps ac semen malorum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 12, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ea pars, quae quasi stirps est hujus quaestionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ingenerantur hominibus mores tam a stirpe generis ac seminis, quam, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>original nature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 95</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exoletā stirpe gentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—So esp. in phrase ab stirpe, <hi rend="ital">utterly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Karthago ab stirpe interiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens ab stirpe exstincta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 34, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne genus ab stirpe sublatum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis intra annum cum stirpe exstinctos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:29:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 29, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut ab stirpibus renata urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stiva: <entryFree id="n45449" type="main" key="sti_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plough-handle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=135" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 135</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 218</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:825" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 825</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:9:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stivarius: <entryFree id="n45450" type="main" key="sti_va_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīvārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>stiva</etym>, <sense id="n45450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ploughman</hi> (late Lat.), Aldhel. Laud. Virg. 28.</sense></entryFree>
stlata: <entryFree id="n45451" type="main" key="stla_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stlāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. latus, q. v. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></etym>, <sense id="n45451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of ship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stlata genus navigii latum magis quam altum, et a latitudine sic appellatum, sed eā consuetudine, quā stlocum pro locum et stlitem pro litem dicebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=312" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 312</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 22, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 5</bibl>.— Acc. to Caper, Orth. p. 2246 P., and Gloss. Philox. s. h. v., <hi rend="ital">a kind of piratical vessel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">corsair</hi>: stlatta, <foreign lang="greek">peiratikou= ska/feos ei)=dos</foreign>.</sense></entryFree>
stlatarius: <entryFree id="n45452" type="main" key="stla_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stlātārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">stlatt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stlata</etym>, <sense id="n45452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a ship</hi> (very rare), Enn. ap. Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:134" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 134</bibl> (Ann. v. 469 Vahl.). —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf.; stlataria purpura, <hi rend="ital">brought by ship</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">costly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:134" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 134</bibl> Schol. (al. <hi rend="ital">deceitful</hi>, cf. Mayor ad Juv. l. l.).</sense></entryFree>
stlembus: <entryFree id="n45453" type="main" key="stlembus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stlembus</orth>, <itype>gravis tardus, sicut Lucilius pedibus stlembum dixit equum pigrum et tardum</itype>, Fest. pp. 312 and 313 Müll. <pb n="1762" /> <cb n="STO" /></entryFree>
stlis: <entryFree id="n45454" type="main" key="stlis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stlis</orth>, v. lis <sense id="n45454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
stlocus: <entryFree id="n45455" type="main" key="stlo^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stlŏcus</orth>, v. locus <sense id="n45455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
stloppus: <entryFree id="n45456" type="hapax" key="stloppus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stloppus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slap</hi> (the sound produced by striking upon the inflated cheek), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:13" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sto: <entryFree id="n45457" type="main" key="sto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sto</orth>, <itype>stĕti, stătum, 1</itype> (scanned stĕtĕrunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:774" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 774</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 10</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>root sta-; Sanscr. sthā, sthalam, locus; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sta-, i(/sthmi</foreign>, to set, place; <foreign lang="greek">stath/r</foreign>, weight; O. H. Germ. stām; Goth. standa; Engl. stand</etym>, <sense id="n45457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stand</hi>, in opposition to sitting, walking, or lying prostrate, <hi rend="ital">to stand still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain standing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand upright.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45457.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45457.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">hos quos videtis stare hic captivos duos, Illi qui astant, hi stant ambo, non sedent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 1 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum virgo staret et Caecilia in sellā sederet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 46, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si iste ibit, ito: stabit, astato simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abi intro, noli stare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 3, 36</bibl></cit>; so (opp. ire) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 95</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 9, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">i: quid stas, lapis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 250</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante ostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad januam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 353</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad undam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orantem juxta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:618" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 618</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic foris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc procul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter in occulto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:28:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 28, 78</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui proximi steterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 35, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sta ilico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui frequentissimi in gradibus concordiae steterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stans pede in uno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit> et saep.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">ita statim stant signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum statuae steterunt in Rostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 34, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa ad impluvium, ad valvas Junonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:23:section=61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 23, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabat acuta silex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerea effigies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 8, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeneus ut stes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 183</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.: Ps.</hi> Statur hic ad hunc modum. <hi rend="ital">Sim.</hi> Statum vide hominis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 44</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Gn.</hi> Quid agitur? <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Statur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">confecto munerum cursu moriar stando,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter sacrum saxumque sto, nec quid faciam scio,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>I am in a pinch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 84</bibl></cit>; v. sacrum.—</sense><sense id="n45457.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45457.4" n="1" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to stand firm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">immovable; to last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi>: cui nec arae patriae domi stant; fractae et disjectae jacent, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl> (Trag. v. 115 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec domus ulla nec urbs stare poterit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stantibus Hierosolymis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 28, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut praeter spem stare muros viderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem innoxiam stare incolumem pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:31:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 31, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta, quae radice novā, non ferro stabat adacto,</quote> <trans><tr>stuck fast</tr>, <tr>remained fixed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 562</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missum stetit inguine ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:132" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 132</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 34</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">8, 415: stat glacies iners,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:732" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 732</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longā stare senectā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:94" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornus stetit inter tempora frontis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:142" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 142</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45457.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tarry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">linger</hi> any where (cf. moror): <cit><quote lang="la">paulisper stetimus in illā ganearum tuarum nidore atque fumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos quos video volitare in foro, quos stare ad curiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: cur non aut stantem comprehenderint, aut fugientem consecuti sint, <hi rend="ital">remaining in the city</hi>, id. Cael, 28, 67; <cit><quote lang="la">so (opp. fugio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum gladiis in conspectu senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui domi stare non poterant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(meretrix) olente in fornice stans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:239" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 239</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of minerals not attracted by the magnet: pondere enim fretae partim stant, quod genus aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1058" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1058</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n45457.6" n="3" level="3"> In milit. lang. </sense><sense id="n45457.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To stand in the ranks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">under arms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisque uti steterat, jacet obtinetque ordinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 86</bibl></cit>: ut sustinere corpora plerique nequeuntes arma sua quisque stantes incumberet, Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 9, 229</bibl> (H. 3, 72 Dietsch): <cit><quote lang="la">cum milites a mane diei jejuni sub armis stetissent defatigati, Auct. B. Afr. 42, 3: primo haud impari stetere acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Asia totius Asiae steterunt vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 58</bibl></cit>: in acie, Auct. B. Hisp. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars acie stabat, Auct. B. Afr. 51, 6: stetit acies in armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 389" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 389</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stetit ordine certo Infelix acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 2, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45457.8" n="b" level="4"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to stand firm</hi> in <cb n="STO" /> fight, <hi rend="ital">stand one's ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain the contest</hi> (opp. abjecto scuto fugere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 54</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in acie stare ac pugnare (opp. in castra refugere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:60:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 60, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarquiniensis, novus hostis non stetit solum, sed etiam ab suā parte Romanum pepulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comminus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque gradu stetimus, certi non cedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contra leonem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Carac. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45457.9" n="c" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a battle, <hi rend="ital">to last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi> (a favorite expression of Livy): <cit><quote lang="la">ibi aliquamdiu atrox pugna stetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu pugna neutro inclinata stetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita anceps dicitur certamen stetisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo stetit ambiguā spe pugna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45457.10" n="4" level="3"> Nautical t. t., <hi rend="ital">to lie</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lie</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ride at anchor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante hostium portus in salo stare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Afr. 62: naves regiae in sinu Maliaco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis instructa in portu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis in salo ad Leptim, Auct. B. Afr. 62, 4: litore puppes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:901" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 901</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45457.11" n="5" level="3"> Of servants, <hi rend="ital">to stand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attend</hi> (very rare): neque pueri eximiā facie stabant, C. Gracch. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:12:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sto exspectans, si quid mihi imperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad cyathum et vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45457.12" n="6" level="3"> Of buildings, cities, etc., <hi rend="ital">to stand finished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be erected</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">intra annum nova urbs stetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam stabant Thebae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia jam stabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:181" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stet Capitolium Fulgens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificant muros ... Stabat opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam stare ratem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:96" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45457.13" n="7" level="3"> Of the countenance, <hi rend="ital">to be unmoved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be at rest</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">stat num quam facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stant ora metu,</quote> <trans><tr>are rigid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:639" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 639</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cur ad patrios non stant tua lumina vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:693" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 693</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45457.14" n="8" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To stand up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand upright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand on end; to bristle up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stiffen</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): papillae, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 391, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 19, 77, § 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">steterunt comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:774" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 774</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 631</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:425" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 425</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines fulvi pulvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:326" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">setae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vertice cristae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:672" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 672</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aristae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:655" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stantes oculi,</quote> <trans><tr>prominent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:133" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis rigentibus et genis stantibus,</quote> <trans><tr>fixed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 24, § 49</bibl></cit>. —In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:73:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 73, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 117, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 75, 2</bibl>.—Rarely of fluids, <hi rend="ital">to coagulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stiffen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis stetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 585" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 585</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45457.15" n="9" level="3"> With <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to stand out with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be thick with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of</hi> any thing (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): stant pulvere campi, Enn. ap. Porphyr. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 592 Vahl.): cupressi Stant rectis foliis, id. ap. Philarg. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 444</bibl> (Ann. v. 268 ib.): stat sentibu' fundus, Lucil. ap. Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 16</bibl>; Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 391, 21</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ager sentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:ib. 391:23" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> ib. 391, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vides ut altā stet nive candidum Soracte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: caelum caligine stat, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 392, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvere caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 408</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvereo globo astra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:124" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stant lumina (Charontis) flammā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stant pulvere Syrtes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 257</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n45457.16" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45457.17" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to stand</hi>: mentes, rectae quae stare solebant, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 16</bibl> (Ann. v. 208 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">stetisse ipsum in fastigio eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45457.18" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45457.19" n="1" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to stand one's ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand firm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unshaken; to endure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persevere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moribus antiquis res stat Romana virisque, Enn. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 2, 21 (Ann. v. 492 Vahl.): disciplinam militarem, quā stetit ad hanc diem Romana res, solvisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res publica staret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stante urbe et curiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:29:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 29, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eo neglecto civitas stare non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam res publica stetisset, quo coeperat statu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui illam (rem publicam) cadere posse stante me non putārant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut stante re publicā facere solebamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim aliter stare possemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 45, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quos homines ordinesque steterim, quibusque munitus fuerim, non ignoras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 29, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum auxilio, qui me stante stare non poterant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respublica stetit virtute tuā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stetit regnum puero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum stetimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:9:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stamus animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stas animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gabinium sine provinciā stare non posse,</quote> <trans><tr>could not hold out</tr>, <tr>subsist</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 6, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nedum sermonum stet honos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 69</bibl></cit>.—Hence, nearly—esse, tantā stat praedita culpā (natura),<cb n="STO" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 199</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pausam stare fragori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:747" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 747</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45457.20" n="b" level="4"> (Acc. to its use as a milit. t. t., <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, I. B. 3.) <hi rend="ital">To maintain the contest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in senatu pulcherrime staremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45457.21" n="c" level="4"> Stare <hi rend="ital">in aliquā re</hi>, simply <hi rend="ital">aliquā re</hi>, and post-class. also <hi rend="ital">alicui rei</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stand firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persevere; to rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adhere to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi> in a thing. </sense><sense id="n45457.22" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">In aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in fide non stetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin in eo non stat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stare oportet in eo, quod sit judicatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:14:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sententiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 44</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n45457.23" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">eā omnes stant sententiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis stare judiciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:28:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 28, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censoris opinione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:47:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 47, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus decreto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stare conditionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stare conventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:25:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 25, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stare jurejurando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:6:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil quo stat loco stabit, omnia sternet abducetque vetustas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Marc. 26:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Marc. 26, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabitur consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi priore foedere staretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famā rerum standum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45457.24" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitri sententiae stare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:7:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 7, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntati patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 26, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3:6" default="NO">36, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei judicatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:32" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 42, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emptioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:13" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:8:27" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 8, 27</bibl> (five times) et saep.—</sense><sense id="n45457.25" n="(d)" level="5"> Stat sententia, <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>, or, impersonally, stat (<hi rend="ital">alicui</hi>), <hi rend="ital">the determination stands</hi> or <hi rend="ital">holds good; I</hi> (<hi rend="ital">thou</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">am determined: Pa.</hi> Vide quid agas. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Stat sententia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibal, postquam ipsi sententia stetit, pergere ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stat sententia tradere mecum Dotalem patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo nobis stet illud, unā vivere in studiis nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stat pectore fixum, Aeetae sociare manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:289" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos in Asiam convertemus: neque adhuc stabat, quo potissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi stat alere morbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ut seponi stetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:68" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stat, casus renovare omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 750</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n45457.26" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">In aliquā re</hi>, or simply <hi rend="ital">aliquā re</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rest on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be fixed on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depend upon</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis in Ascanio stat cura parentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 646</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum fraternā stare concordiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā (disciplinā) stetit Romana res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac arte (i.e. bello) in patriā steti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 44, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:673" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 673</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 163</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis famā quam vi stare res suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud quos virtute quam pecuniā res Romana melius stetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famā bella stare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45457.27" n="2" level="3"> In theatr. lang., of plays and actors, <hi rend="ital">to stand</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">to please</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si intellegeret, cum stetit olim nova (fabula), Actoris operā magis stetisse quam suā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 9 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 9 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partim vix steti, id. Hec. prol. alt. 7: securus, cadat an recto stat fabula talo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi, scripta quibus comoedia prisca viris est, Hoc stabant, hoc sunt imitandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45457.28" n="3" level="3"> Stare, <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pro aliquo</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">aliquā re</hi>, or with <hi rend="ital">adv. loci</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stand by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the side of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adhere to</hi> a person or thing, <hi rend="ital">take the part of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nemo contra civium perditorum dementiam a senatu et a bonorum causā steterit constantius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:273" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 79, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a se potius quam ab adversariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:43:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 43, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a mendacio contra verum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a contrariā ratione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum di prope ipsi cum Hannibale starent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:41:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 41, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabat cum eo senatus majestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobiscum adversus bar, baros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si pro meā patriā ista virtus staret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro jure gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro vobis adversus reges stetimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 22, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 8, 3</bibl> Fabri ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro Jubā atque Afris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro signis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis duces non essent praesentes, staret tamen pro partibus invicta fortuna ultoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:7:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic primo pro Pompei partibus, mox simulatione contra Pompeium stetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:48:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 48, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas pro iisdem partibus standi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 4:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et dii quoque pro meliore stant causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc stas, illinc causam dicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde stetisset, eo se victoria transferret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:4:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: non semper vostra evortet: nunc Juppiter hac stat, <hi rend="ital">stands at your side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stands by you</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 263 Vahl.); imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 565</bibl>.—So with <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci, qui in Darei partibus steterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45457.29" n="4" level="3"> Stare <hi rend="ital">per aliquem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stand to one's account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be chargeable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">owing to one; to lie at one's door</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be one's fault;</hi> followed by a negative consequence or effect, expressed by <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>, <pb n="1763" /> <cb n="STOL" /> <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">ne.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45457.30" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam per eum non stetisset, quin praestaretur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 31, 11</bibl></cit> Weissenb.ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n45457.31" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi> (freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">si poterit fieri, ut ne pater per me stetisse credat, Quominus haec fierent nuptiae, volo: sed si id non poterit, Id faciam in proclivi quod est, per me stetisse, ut credat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:16 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 16 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar ubi cognovit per Afranium stare, quominus proelio dimicaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviter eam rem tulerunt, quod stetisse per Trebonium, quominus oppido potirentur, videbatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nec, quominus perpetua cum eis amicitia esset, per populum Romanum stetisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 33, 2</bibl>; 44, 14, 12.—</sense><sense id="n45457.32" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne praestaremus per vos stetit, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non per milites stetisse, ne vincerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:61:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 61, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi per ipsum staret, ne redderetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 28</bibl></cit>.—Rarely without the negation; so with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quam (ignorantiam) stetit, ut tibi obligarer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 6</bibl></cit> (22), 2; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 17</bibl> supra; <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id est, non per me stetit, sed per illud,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 78</bibl></cit>; with <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si per eum non stetit, parere defuncti voluntati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45457.33" n="5" level="3"> Of price, <hi rend="ital">to stand one in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cost</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Periclum vitae meae tuo stat periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Polybius scribit, centum talentis eam rem Achaeis stetisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sit argumento tibi gratis stare navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:19:section=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 19, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud illi stabunt Aeneia parvo Hospitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 494</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae neque magno Stet pretio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo sanguine ac vulneribus ea Poenis victoria stetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud scio an magno detrimento certamen staturum fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrique vindicta libertatis morte stetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:64:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 64, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu quanto regnis nox stetit una tuis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:812" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 812</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla pestis humano generi pluris stetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stobi: <entryFree id="n45458" type="main" key="Sto_bi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stōbi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient and important city of Paeonia in Northern Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 19, 3</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.; 39, 53, 15; <cit><quote lang="la">40, 21, 1: oppidum Stobi civium Romanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 34</bibl></cit>.—The inhabitants are called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stōbenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15:8:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 15, 8, § 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stobrus: <entryFree id="n45459" type="main" key="stobrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stobrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tree in Carmania yielding an odorous gum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 40, § 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stoebe: <entryFree id="n45460" type="greek" key="stoebe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stoebē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stoibh/</foreign>, <sense id="n45460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> pheos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 54, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:28" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 11, 13, § 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stoechades: <entryFree id="n45461" type="main" key="Stoecha^de^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stoechădĕs</orth> <itype>insulae</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stoixa/des</foreign>, <sense id="n45461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a group of islands on the southern coast of Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Massilia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Isles d'Hyères</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 79</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:page=293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. p. 293</bibl> Orell.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">stoechăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. herba), <hi rend="ital">French lavender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sticados</hi>: Lavandula Stoechas, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 107, § 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:42" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 7, 27, § 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
