stoice: <entryFree id="n45462" type="main" key="Sto_i^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stōĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. Stoicus.</entryFree>
stoicida: <entryFree id="n45463" type="main" key="Sto_i^ci^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stōĭcĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Stoicus</etym>, <sense id="n45463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nickname of a voluptuary who gave himself out for a Stoic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:65" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stoicus: <entryFree id="n45464" type="main" key="Sto_i^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stōĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stwi+ko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n45464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Stoic philosophy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to the Stoics</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Stoic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">schola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 123:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 123, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 22:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:15" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:69:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 69, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dogmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:121" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoicum est,</quote> <trans><tr>it is a saying of the Stoics</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 26, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non loquor tecum Stoicā linguā, sed hac submissiore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 13:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est aliquid in illo Stoici dei: nec cor nec caput habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apoc. 8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apoc. 8</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stōĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Stoic philosopher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Stoic</hi>, Cic. Par. praef. § 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 160</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 300</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:29:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 29, 61</bibl>; and in philosophical writings saepissime.—</sense><sense id="n45464.1" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stōĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the Stoic philosophy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 6, 15</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stōĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">like a Stoic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Stoically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere austere et Stoice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 35, 74</bibl></cit>: dicere, id. Par. praef. § 3.</sense></entryFree>
stoidis: <entryFree id="n45465" type="main" key="Sto_i^dis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stōĭdis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-des</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island off the Indian coast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous for pearls</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoades quaestuosa margaritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 25, 28, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoadis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 34, 54, § 106</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stola: <entryFree id="n45466" type="greek" key="sto^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stolh/</foreign>, <sense id="n45466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a long upper garment.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45466.1" n="I" level="1"> Orig., as with the Greeks, worn by any one: squalidā saeptus stolā, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 537, 27</bibl> (Trag. v. 373 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:654" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 654</bibl>: saeptus mendici stolā, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 537, 28</bibl> (Trag. v. 372 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">lugubri stolā succincta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 198, 4</bibl></cit> (Trag. <cb n="STOL" /> v. 134 id.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">muliebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 537:29 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 537, 29 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n45466.2" n="II" level="1"> Later, with the Romans, in partic., </sense><sense id="n45466.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a long female upper garment</hi>, worn by the Roman matrons, and reaching from the neck to the ankles, <hi rend="ital">a robe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stole</hi> (cf. palla): <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenta muliebria ... veluti stolae, pallia, tunicae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vir fortis stolam indutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 13:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Dianae) erat admodum amplum signum cum stolā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:34:section=74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 34, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad talos stola demissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:52" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 3, 52</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:252" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 252</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:93:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 93, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:5:1" default="NO">10, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 12, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam stolam dedisset, in matrimonio conlocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 44</bibl></cit>.—Hence, also, of <hi rend="ital">the dress</hi> of a voluptuary, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 71</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a cithern-player,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:13:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:654" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 654</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the priests of Isis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 269, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45466.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a noble woman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lady</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">matron</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic eques, hic juvenum coetu stola mixta laborat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:235" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 235</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 12, § 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45466.5" n="III" level="1"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">a royal robe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:15:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 15, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45466.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of the Jewish priests</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 3, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45466.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A dress of ceremony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:20:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 20, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stolatus: <entryFree id="n45467" type="main" key="sto^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stola</etym>. <sense id="n45467.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">dressed in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wearing a</hi> stola: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.—Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏlātae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = matronae, <hi rend="ital">noble dames</hi>, <hi rend="ital">matrons</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 44, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45467.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudor,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>befitting a matron</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:36:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 36, 8</bibl></cit>: Ulixes, <hi rend="ital">Ulysses in petticoats</hi>, a jocose appellation of Livia on account of her cunning, Calig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stolide: <entryFree id="n45468" type="main" key="sto^li^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏlĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. stolidus <sense id="n45468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
stoliditas: <entryFree id="n45469" type="main" key="sto^li^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏlĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stolidus</etym>, <sense id="n45469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtuseness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupidity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stolidity</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:16" default="NO">4, 12, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 80 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
stolidus: <entryFree id="n45470" type="main" key="sto^li^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏlĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root star-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">stereo/s</foreign>, firm; cf. stultus; v. Corss. Ausspr. 2, 155 sq.</etym>. <sense id="n45470.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unmovable;</hi> and hence, <hi rend="ital">slow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coarse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncultivated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi> (class.; cf.: fatuus, insipiens, stupidus, stultus, insulsus).—</sense><sense id="n45470.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: stolidum genus Aeacidarum Bellipotentes sunt magi' quam sapientipotentes, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:56:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 56, 116</bibl> (Ann. v. 187 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">nam vi depugnare sues stolidi soliti sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 56, 116</bibl></cit> (Ann. v. 109 id.).—</sense><sense id="n45470.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">senseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slow of mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stolid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mī stolido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stulti, stolidi, fatui, fungi, bardi, blenni, buccones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid, stolide, clamas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix tandem sensi stolidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: indocti stolidique, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 184</bibl>: Lentulus perincertum stolidior an vanior, Sall. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 4, 4</bibl> (H. 4, 35 Dietsch): <cit><quote lang="la">dux ipse inter stolidissimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 28, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o vatum stolidissime, falleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:774" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 774</bibl></cit>.—Of the Stoics, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 641</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1068" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 1068</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45470.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est stultius neque stolidius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 162</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum est hoc stolidius saxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures (Midae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 175</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">barba (Jovis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:28" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 21, 10</bibl></cit>: hujus generis causarum alia sunt quieta, nihil agentia, stolida quodammodo, i. e, <hi rend="ital">inert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inoperative</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:15:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 15, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stolida impudensque postulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiducia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:46:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 46, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procacitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:42:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 42, 19</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏlĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">stupidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stolidly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45470.4" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">id non promissum magis stolide quam stolide creditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:17" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stolide castra subgressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 67</bibl></cit> Dietsch.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 5, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45470.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">stolide tument pulmonea (mala),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stolo: <entryFree id="n45471" type="main" key="sto^lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shoot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">branch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twig</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">scion springing from the stock</hi> or <hi rend="ital">root of a tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a useless sucker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">water-shoot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Licinius Stolo) propter diligentiam culturae Stolonum confirmavit cognomen, quod nullus in ejus fundo reperiri poterat stolo, quod effodiebat circum arbores, e radicibus, quae nascerentur e solo, quos stolones appellabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Stolonum Liciniae genti (cognomen): ita appellatur in ipsis arboribus fruticatio inutilis, unde et pampinatio inventa primo Stoloni dedit nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 1, 1, § 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:150" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 20, 34, § 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:95" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 13, 20, § 95</bibl>; 17, 26, 39, § 248; 27, 13, 109, § 133.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45472" type="main" key="Sto^lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stŏlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cognomen in the</hi> gens Licinia; v. 1. stolo. <cb n="STOM" /></sense></entryFree>
stomacace: <entryFree id="n45473" type="greek" key="sto^ma^ca^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏmăcăcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stomaka/kh</foreign>, <sense id="n45473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disease of the gums</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scurvy of the mouth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 3, 6, § 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stomachabundus: <entryFree id="n45474" type="hapax" key="sto^ma^cha_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏmăchābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stomachor</etym>, <sense id="n45474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pettish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">angry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stomachy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stomachanter: <entryFree id="n45475" type="main" key="sto^ma^chanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏmăchanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. stomachor.</entryFree>
stomachatio: <entryFree id="n45476" type="main" key="sto^ma^cha_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏmăchātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">anger</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 33, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stomachicus: <entryFree id="n45477" type="greek" key="sto^ma^chi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏmăchĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">stomaxiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n45477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disordered in the stomach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having a disease of the stomach</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 24:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 24, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 39, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:123" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 14, 75, § 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:60" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 5, 24, § 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stomachor: <entryFree id="n45478" type="main" key="sto^ma^chor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏmăchor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n45478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [stomachus, II.], <hi rend="ital">to be irritated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peevish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pettish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vexed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">angry</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">out of humor; to fume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fret</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in Cic.; syn.: irascor, succenseo). </sense><sense id="n45478.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si stomachabere et moleste feres, plura dicemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; so (with irasci) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:326" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 95, 326</bibl>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">jucundissimis tuis litteris stomachatus sum in extremo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximam stomachandi occasionem adripio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dubito, quin mirere atque etiam stomachere, quod tecum de eādem re agam saepius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, F, § 17.— With <hi rend="ital">si</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachabatur senex, si quid asperius dixeram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:33:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 33, 93</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachari cum aliquo,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>to quarrel with him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 267</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">ob</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum prave sectum stomacheris ob unguem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 104</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n45478.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be angry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vexed at</hi> any thing (very rare, and only with the general objects aliquid or omnia). stomachor omnia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 21, 3</bibl>: si quid stomachor, August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">id equidem adveniens mecum stomachabar modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus stomachata biles Venereas,</quote> <trans><tr>nursing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 172, 31</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏmăchanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">irritably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peevishly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pettishly</hi>: arridens, Aug Vit. Beat. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
stomachose: <entryFree id="n45479" type="main" key="sto^ma^cho_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏmăchōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. stomachosus.</entryFree>
stomachosus: <entryFree id="n45480" type="main" key="sto^ma^cho_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏmăchōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stomachus, II.</etym>, <sense id="n45480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wrathful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">angry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irritable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ill-humored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peevish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pettish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choleric</hi> (rare but class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. iracundus): eques,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachosa et quasi submorosa ridicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:69:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 69, 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus acuminis saepe stomachosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:236" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 67, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus irarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachosiores litteras meas, quas dicas esse, non intellego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 5</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏmăchōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">angrily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peevishly; comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rescripsi ei stomachosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 5, 3</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 11, 5</bibl>: <foreign lang="greek">qumikw/teron</foreign> eram jocatus, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 193</bibl> P.).</sense></entryFree>
stomachus: <entryFree id="n45481" type="greek" key="sto^ma^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏmăchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sto/maxos</foreign>. <sense id="n45481.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The gullet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the alimentary canal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">œsophagus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam ad radices ejus (oris) haerens excipit stomachus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:135" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 26</bibl>, n. 2, § 15.—</sense><sense id="n45481.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the stomach</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">eas cum stomachi calore concoxerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 26, § 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum gulae fauces vocantur, extremum stomachus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 68, § 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tendit (gula) ad stomachum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 66, § 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 632</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachum fovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 23, 44, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomacho laborare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestuans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissolutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 26, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortiores stomachi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 7, 26, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marcens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora, quae stomacho praebent incendia nostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:872" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 872</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualia lassum Pervellunt stomachum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:100" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 100</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45481.2" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45481.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liking</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ludi non tui stomachi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nosti stomachi mei fastidium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: stomacho esse languenti, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc agello stomachum multa sollicitant, vicinitas urbis, opportunitas viae, modus ruris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 24, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45481.4" n="2" level="3"> Bonus stomachus, <hi rend="ital">good digestion;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">peace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good-humor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bono sane stomacho contenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus quos difficile cottidie habere bonum stomachum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12</bibl></cit>, praef.—</sense><sense id="n45481.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Distaste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dislike</hi> to any thing; hence, <hi rend="ital">displeasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irritation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vexation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chagrin</hi> concerning any thing (freq., esp. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">locus ille animi nostri, stomachus ubi habitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 15, 2</bibl>: <pb n="1764" /> <cb n="STRA" /> consuetudo diurna callum jam obduxit stomacho meo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bile et stomacho aliquid fingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamore ac stomacho non queo labori suppeditare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo exarsit iracundiā ac stomacho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:20:section=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 20, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula plena stomachi et querelarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in me stomachum erumpant, cum sint tibi irati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in stomacho ridere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risum magis quam stomachum movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachum movere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 13, 28</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: stomachum facere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tum mihi majori stomacho, quam ipsi Quinto, fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intelleges eam (fortitudinem) stomacho non egere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:24:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 24, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summo cum labore, stomacho miseriāque erudiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec gravem Pelidae stomachum cedere nescii Conamur (scribere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—In jest, for the contrary affection: Cicero reddens rationem, cur illa C. Caesaris tempora tam patienter toleraret, Haec aut animo Catonis ferenda sunt, aut Ciceronis stomacho, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with his patience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endurance</hi>, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:102" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stomatice: <entryFree id="n45482" type="greek" key="sto^ma^ti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏmătĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stomatikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n45482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a medicine for diseases of the mouth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 9, 11, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:136" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 7, 71, § 136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">efficacior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 13, 73, § 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 64" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stomis: <entryFree id="n45483" type="main" key="sto^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏmis</orth>, <itype>mĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stomi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n45483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the mouthpiece of a flute-player</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:Sat. Fragm. 15:12" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> Sat. Fragm. 15, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stomoma: <entryFree id="n45484" type="greek" key="sto^mo_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏmōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sto/mwma</foreign>, <sense id="n45484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fine scales which fly off in hammering</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 11, 25, § 108</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 5</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
storax: <entryFree id="n45485" type="main" key="sto^rax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏrax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, v. styrax.</entryFree>
storbus: <entryFree id="n45486" type="main" key="storbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">storbus</orth>, v. stobrus.</entryFree>
storea: <entryFree id="n45487" type="main" key="sto^re^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏrĕa</orth> (in good MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏrĭa</orth>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>from the root ster, sterno; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">stope/nnumi</foreign>, to spread out</etym>, <sense id="n45487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">covering</hi> made of plaited straw, rushes, rope, etc.; <hi rend="ital">a straw-mat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rush-mat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rope-mat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 16, 18, § 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
storia: <entryFree id="n45488" type="main" key="sto^ri^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (late Lat.), = historia, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:99" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 99</bibl>.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n45489" type="main" key="sto^ri^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏrĭa</orth>, v. storea.</entryFree>
straba: <entryFree id="n45490" type="main" key="stra^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">străba</orth>, v. strava.</entryFree>
strabo: <entryFree id="n45491" type="greek" key="stra^bo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">străbo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">stră-bōnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 68, 8</bibl>; v. also strabus), = <foreign lang="greek">strabw/n</foreign>. <sense id="n45491.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, that has oblique, distorted eyes, i. e. <hi rend="ital">one who squints strongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a squinter</hi> (class.): ecquos (deos) si non tam strabones, at paetulos esse arbitramur? * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 44</bibl>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 39, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45491.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, one who looks askance, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an envious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jealous person</hi> (ante-class.), Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 27, 7</bibl> (Sat. Fragm. 27, 8); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 4</bibl> (opp. integris oculis).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45492" type="main" key="Stra^bo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Străbo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. strabo</etym>, <sense id="n45492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 81 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 150</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strabonus: <entryFree id="n45493" type="main" key="stra^bo_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">străbōnus</orth>, v. 1. strabo <sense id="n45493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
strabus: <entryFree id="n45494" type="main" key="stra^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">străbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. strabo</etym>, <sense id="n45494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">squinting</hi>: de Venere paetā strabam facit, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 684 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> P.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">strabones sunt strabi quos nunc dicimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 27, 2</bibl></cit>: straba foeditas, Cassiod. Orthogr. praef. p. 2278.</sense></entryFree>
strages: <entryFree id="n45495" type="main" key="stra_ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strāges</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sterno, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n45495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a throwing down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throwing to the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrowing; an overthrow; confusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confused heap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mass</hi> (cf.: acervus, strues; not freq. till after the Aug. per., esp. in Liv.; not in Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n45495.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45495.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n45495.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">strage armorum saepta via est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:205" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificiorum et hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obstantis molis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum in trepidatione nocturna passim relictarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boum hominumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canum volucrumque aviumque boumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercituum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>, ext. 1.— </sense><sense id="n45495.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dabit ille (nimbus) ruinas Arboribus stragemque satis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atrox tempestas multis locis stragem fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strage ac ruinā fudere Gallos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45495.5" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">a mortal overthrow; a defeat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slaughter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">massacre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">butchery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carnage</hi> (syn.: caedes, clades): stragem horribilem caedemque vereri, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 12, 20; so (with caedes) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:3:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 10, 3, 1</bibl>; Val. Max. <cb n="STRA" /> 5, 6, 5; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quantas acies stragemque ciebunt!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:829" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 829</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confusae stragis acervus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 504</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">complere strage campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 24</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">strages facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strages edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:9:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 526</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 784</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:2:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 33, 2, 2</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also II.: cruentae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 132</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45495.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas ego pugnas et quantas strages edidi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stragulatus: <entryFree id="n45496" type="main" key="stra_gu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strāgŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = stragulatas vestes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:31:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 31, 22</bibl>.</entryFree>
stragulum: <entryFree id="n45497" type="main" key="stra_gu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strāgŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. stragulus, II.</entryFree>
stragulus: <entryFree id="n45498" type="main" key="stra_gu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strāgŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sterno, I.; v. the passages from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=167" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 167</bibl> Müll. under II.</etym>, <sense id="n45498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves for spreading</hi> or <hi rend="ital">covering</hi> over any thing (viz., over a bed). </sense><sense id="n45498.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: vestis, <hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bedspread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coverlet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blanket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rug</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carpet</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 133</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 10</bibl>; 2, 2, 7; 2, 2, 72; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:118 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 118 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 51, 52, § 171</bibl>; cf.: in strato omne vestimentum contineri, quod iniciatur, Labeo ait; neque enim dubium est, quin stragula vestis sit omne pallium, quod Graeci <foreign lang="greek">peri/strwma</foreign> vocant. In victu ergo vestem accipiemus, non stragula, in stratu omnem stragulam vestem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:45" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45498.2" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> freq. </sense><sense id="n45498.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">strāgŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n45498.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A pall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a covering for a corpse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 78, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45498.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A horse-cloth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:25:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 25, § 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45498.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">strāgŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a spread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rug</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carpet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mattress</hi>, etc. (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tapes, tapetum): hac (culcita) quicquid insternebant, a sternendo stragulum appellabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=167" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 167</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 2</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a bed-covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bedspread</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 58, 83, § 226</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:79" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:147 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 147 al.</bibl>—Of <hi rend="ital">a covering for a corpse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 42, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 50</bibl>. —Of <hi rend="ital">a horse-cloth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blanket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">housing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:86:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 86, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of any thing soft put under brooding fowls, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 51, § 100</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 7, § 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stramen: <entryFree id="n45499" type="main" key="stra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sterno, I.</etym>, <sense id="n45499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">straw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">litter</hi> spread under any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose); <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectam stramine vidit Forte casam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 447</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:562" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 562</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:152 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 54, 75, § 152 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 701</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:184" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:56" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">straminum mollities, of a bed,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:8" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stramentarius: <entryFree id="n45500" type="hapax" key="stra_menta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strāmentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stramentum</etym>, <sense id="n45500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to straw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">falces,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>for cutting straw</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stramenticius: <entryFree id="n45501" type="main" key="stra_menti^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strāmentĭcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of straw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">straw-</hi>: casae, Auct. B. Hisp. 16, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 63, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stramentor: <entryFree id="n45502" type="hapax" key="stra_mentor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strāmentor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n45502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to fetch straw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idmon cum stramentatum exisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stramentum: <entryFree id="n45503" type="main" key="stra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sterno, I.</etym>, <sense id="n45503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which serves for spreading</hi> or <hi rend="ital">littering.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45503.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Straw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">litter</hi> (syn. palea): <cit><quote lang="la">fasces stramentorum ac virgultorum incenderunt,</quote> <trans><tr>bundles of straw</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:15" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desectam cum stramento segetem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 7</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a straw-bed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in stramentis pernoctare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:50" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 18, § 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 8, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si et stramentis incubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:117 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 117 al.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquis enim torus e stramento erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 73, § 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stramentum ab stratu, quod id substernatur pecori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:50:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 50, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a thatched roof</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">casae, quae more Gallico stramentis erant tectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45503.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rug</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coverlet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">housing</hi>, etc. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">mulorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 45</bibl></cit>: his verbis et vestimenta et stramenta contineri; <cit><quote lang="la">sine his enim vivere neminem posse,</quote> <trans><tr>bedclothes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:234" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cameli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:31:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 31, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stramineus: <entryFree id="n45504" type="main" key="stra_mi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strāmĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stramen</etym>, <sense id="n45504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of straw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">straw-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quirites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:631" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casa,</quote> <trans><tr>covered with straw</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:16:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 16, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 9, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strangias: <entryFree id="n45505" type="greek" key="strangi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strangĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">straggi/as</foreign>, <sense id="n45505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of Grecian wheat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 12, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strangulabilis: <entryFree id="n45506" type="hapax" key="strangu^la_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strangŭlābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>strangulo</etym>, <sense id="n45506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be choked</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strangled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima submersu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
strangulatio: <entryFree id="n45507" type="main" key="strangu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strangŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a choking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffocating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strangulation</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 13, § 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulvae,</quote> <trans><tr>suffocation of the womb</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 15, 57, § 162</bibl></cit>; cf. strangulatus.</sense></entryFree>
strangulator: <entryFree id="n45508" type="hapax" key="strangu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strangŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a choker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strangler</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Commodi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 14</bibl></cit>. <cb n="STRA" /></sense></entryFree>
strangulatrix: <entryFree id="n45509" type="hapax" key="strangu^la_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strangŭlātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>strangula tor</etym>, <sense id="n45509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that chokes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strangles</hi>: faucium (manus), Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 1103.</sense></entryFree>
strangulatus: <entryFree id="n45510" type="main" key="strangu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strangŭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>strangulo</etym>, <sense id="n45510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a choking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strangling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulvae,</quote> <trans><tr>suffocation of the womb</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 18, 75, § 197</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:155" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 15, 90, § 155</bibl>; cf. strangulatio.</sense></entryFree>
strangulo: <entryFree id="n45511" type="greek" key="strangu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strangŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">straggala/w</foreign> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=96" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 96</bibl> Müll.), <sense id="n45511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to throttle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choke;</hi> and, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to stifle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffocate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strangle</hi> (syn. suffoco). </sense><sense id="n45511.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): Domitium strangulavit, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">strangulata laqueo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strangulatus in carcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:1:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venena quae strangulando necant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 7, 26, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obesi difficultate spirandi strangulantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piro strangulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strangulatae in oleo ranae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 38, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuniculos vapore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne nimio sanguine stranguletur pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:38:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 38, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">volvam strangulati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 13, 15, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus (togae) nec strangulet nec fluat,</quote> <trans><tr>too closely drawn together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:140" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 140</bibl></cit>.—In an obscene double sense: si dicimus, Ille patrem strangulavit, honorem non praefamur. Sin de Aureliā aliquid aut Lolliā, honos praefandus est, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 4</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45511.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: hedera arbores sugit et strangulat, <hi rend="ital">chokes</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">kills</hi>, <hi rend="ital">makes unfruitful</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 34, 62, § 152</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:26:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">23: solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 8, 4, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces tumentes strangulant vocem,</quote> <trans><tr>choke</tr>, <tr>stifle</tr>, <tr>constrain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sonitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 43, 43, § 113</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tibi sepositas infelix strangulat arca Divitias,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>contains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:150" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 150</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45511.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to torment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torture</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">strangulat inclusus dolor atque exaestuat intus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:1:63" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptates in hoc nos amplectuntur, ut strangulent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 51:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 51, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures nimiā congesta pecunia curā Strangulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:12" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 12</bibl></cit>: venditor omnes causas, quibus strangulatur, exponat, i. e. <hi rend="ital">is forced to the sale</hi>, Cod. Th. 12, 3, 1.</sense></entryFree>
stranguria: <entryFree id="n45512" type="greek" key="strangu_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strangūrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">straggouri/a</foreign>, <sense id="n45512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a painful discharge of urine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strangury</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:19:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 19, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 74, § 99</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> written as Greek, and transl. by urinae difficultas).</sense></entryFree>
stranguriosus: <entryFree id="n45513" type="hapax" key="strangu_ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strangūrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>stranguria</etym>, <sense id="n45513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who is afflicted with strangury</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 26 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
straor: <entryFree id="n45514" type="main" key="Straor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Straor</orth>, v. Stratos, II.</entryFree>
strata: <entryFree id="n45515" type="main" key="stra_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. sterno <sense id="n45515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
strategema: <entryFree id="n45516" type="greek" key="stra^te_ge_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strătēgēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype> (<case>dat.</case> and <sense id="n45516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> strategematibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:4 praef" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 4 praef.</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">strath/ghma</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n45516.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a piece of generalship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stratagem</hi>: consilium illud imperatorium fuit, quod Graeci <foreign lang="greek">strath/ghma</foreign> appellant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 4</bibl>, De strategematis; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:13:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:12" default="NO">2, 6, 12</bibl> sq.; 3, 10, 2 et saep.; and cf. the work of Frontinus, Strategematicōn libri quattuor.—</sense><sense id="n45516.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">any stratagem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trick</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interim Rufio noster strategemate hominem percussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
strategematicus: <entryFree id="n45517" type="greek" key="stra^te_ge_ma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strătēgēmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">strathghmatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n45517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to military stratagems</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stratagemical;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Strătēgēmătĭca</orth> (<hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> -ōn), the title of a work of S. Julius Frontinus.</sense></entryFree>
strategeum: <entryFree id="n45518" type="greek" key="stra^te_ge_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strătēgēum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-īum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">strathgei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n45518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the general's tent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the name of a public building in Smyrna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 2, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strategia: <entryFree id="n45519" type="greek" key="stra^te_gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strătēgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">strathgi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n45519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a government</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a district</hi>, <hi rend="ital">province</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thracia in strategias quinquaginta divisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 9, 10, § 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strategica: <entryFree id="n45520" type="greek" key="stra^te_gi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strătēgĭca</orth>, <itype>ōn</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">strathgika/</foreign>, <sense id="n45520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the deeds of a general</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 4</bibl>, praef.</sense></entryFree>
strategus: <entryFree id="n45521" type="greek" key="stra^te_gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strătēgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">strathgo/s</foreign>. * <sense id="n45521.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a military leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commander</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec strategus, nec tyrannus quisquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45521.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the presider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">president</hi> at a banquet: <cit><quote lang="la">strategum te facio huic convivio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stratie: <entryFree id="n45522" type="main" key="Stra^ti^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strătĭē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Arcadia</hi>, Stat.</ Th. 4, 285.</sense></entryFree>
stratii: <entryFree id="n45523" type="main" key="Stratii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stratii</orth>, v. Stratos, I.</entryFree>
stratio: <entryFree id="n45524" type="gloss" key="stra^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strătĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sterno</etym>, <sense id="n45524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the laying of cloths and coverings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the preparation of a</hi> <pb n="1765" /> <cb n="STRA" /> <hi rend="ital">room for a feast</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 404, 306</bibl>; Inser. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Ac. Rom. Archaeol. 2:462" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> Ac. Rom. Archaeol. 2, 462</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stratiotes: <entryFree id="n45525" type="greek" key="stra^ti^o_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strătĭōtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stratiw/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n45525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a water-plant;</hi> either <hi rend="ital">the aloe-leaved watersoldier</hi>: Stratiotes aloides, Linn.; or <hi rend="ital">the great duck-weed</hi>: Pistia stratiotes, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 18, 105, § 169</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">stră-tĭōtĭcē</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stratioticus: <entryFree id="n45526" type="greek" key="stra^ti^o_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strătĭōtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">stratiwtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n45526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a soldier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soldierlike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">military</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 49</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">strătĭōtĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of eye-salve</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 33" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 33</bibl>; Inscr. Spon. Misc. Ant. p. 237.</sense></entryFree>
stratioton: <entryFree id="n45527" type="main" key="Stra^ti^o_ton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strătĭōton</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n45527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory in Ethiopia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 173</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stratippocles: <entryFree id="n45528" type="main" key="Stra^ti_ppo_^cles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strătīppō^cles</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stratius: <entryFree id="n45529" type="main" key="Stra_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strātĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the physician of king Eumenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 19, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strato: <entryFree id="n45530" type="main" key="Stra^to_^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strătō^</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Străton</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stra/twn</foreign>. <sense id="n45530.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A philosopher of Lampsacus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 9, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 5, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45530.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A slave and physician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:63:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 63, 176</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">64, 179</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45530.2" n="III" level="1"> Stratonis turris, <hi rend="ital">a town of Palestine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise called Cœsarea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kaisariyeh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 13, 14, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stratocles: <entryFree id="n45531" type="main" key="Stra^to_^cles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strătō^cles</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stratoklh=s</foreign>, <sense id="n45531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated comedian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:178" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 178</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:99" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stratoclia: <entryFree id="n45532" type="main" key="Stra^to_^cli_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strătō^clīa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-clēa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*strato/kleia</foreign>, <sense id="n45532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the Cimmerian Bosporus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 6, 6, § 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
straton: <entryFree id="n45533" type="main" key="Stra^ton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Străton</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Peripatetic philosopher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 13, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stratonice: <entryFree id="n45534" type="main" key="Stra^to^ni_ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strătŏnīcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Demetrius Poliorcetes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and wife of Seleucus Nicator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 7</bibl>, ext. 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:139 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 139 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
