stratonicea: <entryFree id="n45535" type="main" key="Stra^to^ni_ce_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strătŏnīcēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a considerable town of Caria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Eski-hissar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 18, 7</bibl> and 10.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n45535.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Strătŏnīcēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Stratonicea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Menippus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Stratonicea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:315" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 91, 315</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45535.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Strătŏnīcensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Stratonicea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 18, 4</bibl></cit> and 7.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stră-tŏnīcenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Stratonicea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stratonicis: <entryFree id="n45536" type="main" key="Stra^to^ni_cis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strătŏnīcis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stratoniki/s</foreign>, <sense id="n45536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an appellation of Venus among the Smyrneans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 63</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Strătŏnīcēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the temple of Venus Stratonicis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stratonicus: <entryFree id="n45537" type="main" key="Stra^to^ni_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strătŏnīcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*strato/nikos</foreign>. <sense id="n45537.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek sculptor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45537.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stratopedon: <entryFree id="n45538" type="greek" key="stra^to^pe^don"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strătŏpĕdon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">strato/pedon</foreign>, <sense id="n45538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a camp</hi>, Jul. Obs. Prodig. 116.</sense></entryFree>
stratophanes: <entryFree id="n45539" type="main" key="Stra^to^pha^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strătŏphănes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a soldier</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strator: <entryFree id="n45540" type="main" key="stra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sterno, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n45540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who saddles a horse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a groom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equerry</hi> (postclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Carac. 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">29, 3, 5</bibl>; Cod. Th. 6, 31; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 27, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 798</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1584</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3250 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n45540.1" n="II" level="1"> From sterno, II. B., <hi rend="ital">a thrower down</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:48:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 48, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stratorius: <entryFree id="n45541" type="main" key="stra^to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strătōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stratum, from sterno</etym>, <sense id="n45541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">used for covering</hi>, = stragulus: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 67</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">strătōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">bedding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:17:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 17, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stratos: <entryFree id="n45542" type="main" key="Stratos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stratos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stratus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stra/tos</foreign>. <sense id="n45542.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Acarnania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Achelous</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 2, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 22, 1</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stratii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Stratos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 22, 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n45542.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river of Hyrcania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 16, 18, § 46</bibl> (al. Straor).</sense></entryFree>
stratum: <entryFree id="n45543" type="main" key="stra_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. sterno <sense id="n45543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
stratura: <entryFree id="n45544" type="main" key="stra_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sterno</etym> (post-Aug.). <sense id="n45544.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A paving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pavement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 40, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3286</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4130</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n45544.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A layer of manure</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Nov. 7, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stratus: <entryFree id="n45545" type="main" key="stra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of sterno.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45546" type="main" key="stra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. stratum, under sterno <sense id="n45546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45547" type="main" key="stra_tus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sterno</etym>. <sense id="n45547.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A spreading</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strewing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:50:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 50, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n45547.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for the usual stratum, <hi rend="ital">a cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in stratu omnem stragulam vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:45" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 45</bibl></cit>; Favorin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:8:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 8, 2</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a horse-cloth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 45 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
strava: <entryFree id="n45548" type="main" key="stra^va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">străva</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ba</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a monument of</hi> <cb n="STRE" /> <hi rend="ital">victory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built of captured arms</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> ad Stat. Th. 12, 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Jornand.</author> Get. 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strebula: <entryFree id="n45549" type="main" key="strebu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strebŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">strebŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">stri-bŭla</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n45549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the flesh about the haunches</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">strebula Umbrico nomine Plautus appellat coxendices hostiarum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=313" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 313</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=312" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 312</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">stribula, ut Opilius scribit, circum coxendices sunt bovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=67" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 67</bibl></cit> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">non placet carnem strebulam appellare, quae taurorum e coxendicibus demitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 230</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stremma: <entryFree id="n45550" type="greek" key="stremma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stremma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stre/mma</foreign>, <sense id="n45550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dislocation</hi>, Pelag. Vet. 16.</sense></entryFree>
strena: <entryFree id="n45551" type="main" key="stre_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sabine</etym>. <sense id="n45551.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prognostic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omen</hi> (Plautin.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45551.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a new-year's present</hi> given for the sake of the omen (syn. xenium; cf. the Fr. <hi rend="ital">étrennes</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 34</bibl>; Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 17, 1 al.</bibl>; cf.: strenam vocamus, quae datur die religioso, ominis boni gratiā, Fest. s. h. v. p. 313 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 18, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strenia: <entryFree id="n45552" type="main" key="Stre_nia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strēnia</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Strēnŭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>strena</etym>, <sense id="n45552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess that presides over new-year's gifts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=47" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 47</bibl> Müll.; Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 16.</sense></entryFree>
strenua: <entryFree id="n45553" type="main" key="Stre_nu^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strēnŭa</orth>, v. Strenia.</entryFree>
strenue: <entryFree id="n45554" type="main" key="stre_nu^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strēnŭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. strenuus <sense id="n45554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
strenuitas: <entryFree id="n45555" type="main" key="stre_nu^i^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strēnŭĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>strenuus</etym>, <sense id="n45555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nimbleness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">briskness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vivacity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">activity</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in the two foll. passages): ab strenuitate et nobilitate strenui et nobiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 15</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">strenuitas antiqua manet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 320</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
strenuo: <entryFree id="n45556" type="hapax" key="stre_nu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strēnŭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make brisk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">busy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum te strenuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 34</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
strenuus: <entryFree id="n45557" type="main" key="stre_nuus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strēnuus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">stereo/s</foreign>, firm, hard; cf. sterilis, and Germ. starren</etym>, <sense id="n45557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brisk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nimble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prompt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">active</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strenuous.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45557.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons (freq. and class.; syn.: fortis, alacer, agilis): mercator strenuus, Cato, R. R. praef. § 3; cf.: vilicus strenuior, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 601</bibl> P. (Sat. 16, 5): <cit><quote lang="la">strenui nimio plus prosunt populi quam arguti et cati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi alii ex Trojā strenui viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:1:17" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strenuior (opp. deterior),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: viri fortissimi et milites strenuissimi, Cato, R. R. praef. § 4; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 32, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">strenuus et fortis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperator in proeliis strenuus et fortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strenui ignavique in victoriā idem audent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so (opp. ignavus) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 69</bibl>; (opp. iners) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 61:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 61, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:51:16" default="NO" valid="yes">51, 16</bibl>: noli me tam strenuum putare, ut ad Nonas recurram, Hirt. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci, gens linguā magis strenua quam factis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 22, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi cessas aut strenuus anteis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 70</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">strenuus militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45557.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Restless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turbulent</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">multi in utroque exercitu, sicut modesti quietique, ita mali et strenui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strenuus in perfidiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45557.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things (not in class. prose): operam reipublicae fortem atque strenuam perhibere, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> ib. 7, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens strenuā facie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus (chirurgi),</quote> <trans><tr>nimble</tr>, <tr>quick</tr>, <tr>dexterous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7 praef.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:1:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strenua nos exercet inertia,</quote> <trans><tr>busy idleness</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transiliebant in vehicula strenuo saltu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:3:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toxica,</quote> <trans><tr>quick</tr>, <tr>speedy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa tam strenuae mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:8:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 8, 20</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">strē-nuē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">briskly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promptly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">actively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strenuously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">strenue quod volumus ostendere factum, celeriuscule dicemus, at aliud otiose, retardabimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 14, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 48</bibl></cit>: converrite scopis, agite strenue, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 195</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">abi prae strenue ac aperi fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificare domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesto fuit sane strenue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—Without a verb: <hi rend="ital">Da.</hi> Jam hercle ego illum nominabo. <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Euge strenue, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 94</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per hos strenuissime omnia bella confecta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> seems not to occur.</sense></entryFree>
strepito: <entryFree id="n45558" type="main" key="stre^pi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĕpĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>strepo</etym>, <sense id="n45558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make a great noise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rattling</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): (corvi) inter se foliis <cb n="STRI" /> strepitant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 413</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viden ut strepitantibus advolet alis Amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:2:17" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma strepitantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsis strepitant incudibus urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:288" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(lugentes) strepitant per urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:1:183" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 1, 183</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
strepitus: <entryFree id="n45559" type="main" key="stre^pi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĕpĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<sense id="n45559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> strepiti, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 490, 8</bibl>; or Trag. v. 205 Vahl.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>strepo</etym>. </sense><sense id="n45559.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> (wild, confused) <hi rend="ital">noise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">din</hi> of any kind; <hi rend="ital">a clashing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crashing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rattling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clattering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clanking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rumbling</hi>, etc. (class. and very freq.; cf.: crepitus, stridor, fragor): strepitus, fremitus, clamor tonitruum, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 2, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">strepitus, crepitus, sonitus, tonitrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: molarum strepitus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 506, 3</bibl> (Com. v. 7 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">fluminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:7:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strepitu nullo clam reserare fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:60" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 60</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ingens valvarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audis quo strepitu janua remugiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscenus, i. e. ventris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 117</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">comitum conventus, strepitus, clamor mulierum Fecere, ut, etc., Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 27: non strepitu, sed maximo clamore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 15, 45</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 1, 2</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">inde fragore gravi strepitus loca terret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prae strepitu et clamore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 27, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno cum strepitu ac tumultu castris egressi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 11</bibl></cit>; so (with tumultus) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 48, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concursus hominum forique strepitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:92:317" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 92, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter strepitum tot bellorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiarum vanissimus strepitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis, sollicitum animal ad nocturnos strepitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino, strepitibus clamoribusque nocturnis attoniti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 15, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45559.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">a</hi> (measured, regular) <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">citharae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testudinis aureae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibicinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
strepo: <entryFree id="n45560" type="main" key="stre^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĕpo</orth>, <itype>ui, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n45560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45560.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45560.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make a noise; to rattle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rumble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murmur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roar</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: fremo, strideo): cum Achivi coepissent Inter se strepere, * Cic. poët. Div. 1, 16, 29: vocibus truculentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes in alvo strepunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 17, 17, § 54</bibl>.—Of musical instruments (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">rauco strepuerunt cornua cantu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">litui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvii strepunt Hibernā nive turgidi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of arms, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">strepit assiduo cava tempora circum Tinnitu galea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:808" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 808</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lancea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:302" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitrua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:145" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 145</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of the place in which the sound is heard: strepit omnis murmure campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 709</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia terrore ac tumultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 25, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 11, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs apparatu belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 51, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures clamoribus plorantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placidum aequor mille navium, remis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum paratu provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons tibiarum cantu tympanorumque sonitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45560.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scythici equitatūs equorum gloriā strepunt,</quote> <trans><tr>ring</tr>, <tr>resound with the glory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 64, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra Albanam arcem sententia Messalini strepebat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>was not heard beyond</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45560.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum sub ipso vallo portisque streperent,</quote> <trans><tr>bawled out</tr>, <tr>vociferated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strepens immania,</quote> <trans><tr>making strenuous accusations</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (lucus) Capitolium montem strepit,</quote> <trans><tr>fills with rustling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 3:9" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 3, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
strepsiceros: <entryFree id="n45561" type="greek" key="strepsi^ce^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strepsĭcĕros</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">streyike/rws</foreign>, <sense id="n45561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of animal with twisted horns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called by the Africans</hi> adax, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:214" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 53, 79, § 214</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
streptos: <entryFree id="n45562" type="greek" key="streptos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">streptos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">strepto/s</foreign>, <sense id="n45562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twisted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva, a kind of grape,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stria: <entryFree id="n45563" type="main" key="stri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a furrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">channel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hollow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā aratrum vomere striam facit, sulcus vocatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:29:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 29, 3</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">the flute</hi> of a column, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1, 7 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; 4, 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 46, § 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
striata: <entryFree id="n45564" type="main" key="stri^a_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>strio</etym>, <sense id="n45564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of shellfish;</hi> perh. <hi rend="ital">a scallop</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
striatura: <entryFree id="n45565" type="main" key="stri^a_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a being channelled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fluted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fluting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">striature</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stribligo: <entryFree id="n45566" type="main" key="stribli_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">striblīgo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">stribĭlīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">streblo/s</foreign>, twisted, awry</etym>, <sense id="n45566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an impropriety in language</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a solecism</hi> (ante- and post-class.): soloecismus Latino<pb n="1766" /> <cb n="STRI" />  vocabulo a Sinnio Capitone ejusdemque aetatis aliis imparilitas appellatus, vetustioribus Latinis stribligo dicebatur, a versurā videlicet et pravitate tortuosae orationis, tamquam strobiligo quaedam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:20:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stribula: <entryFree id="n45567" type="main" key="stribu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stribŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. strebula.</entryFree>
stricte: <entryFree id="n45568" type="main" key="stricte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strictē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. stringo, <sense id="n45568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
strictim: <entryFree id="n45569" type="main" key="strictim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strictim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>strictus, from stringo</etym>, <sense id="n45569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">straitly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">closely.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45569.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (ante- and postclass., and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">strictim attondere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>close to the skin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juncta crates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cithara balteo caelato aptata strictim sustinetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2, p. 351, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45569.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">slightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superficially.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45569.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (Ciceronian, but very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45569.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of speech, <hi rend="ital">briefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cursorily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summarily</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec nunc strictim dicta, apertiora fient infra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=39" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 39</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">breviter strictimque dicere (opp. copiosissime),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strictim dicere (opp. multa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:8:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subjungere de ceteris artibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 73</bibl></cit> saep.</sense></entryFree>
strictio: <entryFree id="n45570" type="main" key="stricti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stringo</etym>, <sense id="n45570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pressing together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:9:79" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 9, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3:9:100 al" default="NO">3, 9, 100 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
strictivilla: <entryFree id="n45571" type="main" key="stricti^villa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strictĭvilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stringo-villus, that plucks off her hair</etym>, <sense id="n45571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an appellation of a vile woman</hi>, Plaut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 6</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 169, 8</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=65" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 65</bibl> Müll. written strittabillae).</sense></entryFree>
strictivus: <entryFree id="n45572" type="hapax" key="stricti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strictīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stringo</etym>, <sense id="n45572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is stripped</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plucked off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 146, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
strictor: <entryFree id="n45573" type="hapax" key="strictor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strictor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who strips</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plucks off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">olearum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 144, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
strictoria: <entryFree id="n45574" type="main" key="stricto_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strictōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shirt with long sleeves</hi>, Edict. Diocl. 7, 56 al.</sense></entryFree>
strictura: <entryFree id="n45575" type="main" key="strictu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strictūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n45575.0" n="I" level="1"> In abstr., <hi rend="ital">a contraction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compression</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stricture</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">stomachi (opp. solutio),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:7:9 sq" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 7, 9 sq.</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:8:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 4, 8, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:5:4:64" default="NO">5, 4, 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45575.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pressure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 2, 789</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementior est virtutis strictura quam poenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Spir. Sanc. 1, 9, § 108</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45575.2" n="II" level="1"> In concr., <hi rend="ital">a mass of wrought iron</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bar of iron</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 21, 11</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> A. 10, 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 41, § 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 421</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strictus: <entryFree id="n45576" type="main" key="strictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from stringo.</entryFree>
strideo: <entryFree id="n45577" type="main" key="stri_deo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strīdeo</orth>, <itype>di, 2</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">strīdo</orth>, <itype>di, 3</itype> (both forms equally in use; <sense id="n45577.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>) [perh. root star, to resound; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tri/zw, to/rgos</foreign>; also Lat. turdus, sterto, trisso], <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">utter any harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hissing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whistling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grating</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">creaking sound; to creak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hiss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whizz</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whistle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rattle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">buzz</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf.: strepo, fremo): ferri stridit acumen, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 838</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 364 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">striderat hasta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 817 P. (Ann. v. 365 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">candens ferrum e fornacibus Stridit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 149</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 450</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 171</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 279</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">striduntque cavernis Stricturae chalybum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentum Cerberus ore Stridet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:72" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 288</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">striges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:140" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gryllus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbaraque horribili stridebat tibia cantu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serrae stridentis acerbus Horror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foribus cardo aënis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 449</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare refluentibus undis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alae cygnorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 397</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagitta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 319</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 502</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 418</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudentes aquilone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:11:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeger dentibus stridet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jecur in verubus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 770" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 770</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 26, 4</bibl></cit>.—With human subjects, of any loud or inharmonious sound: quidnam hoc soniti est, quod stridunt foris? Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 491, 24</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 133 Rib.). cum striderat (Alcestis) retracta rursus inferis, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 9, p. 867</bibl> P. (Trag. Rel. v. 57 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">Troglodytae stridunt magis quam loquuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridunt animae currumque sequuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:770" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 770</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressoque diu stridere molari,</quote> <trans><tr>gnash</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:160" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 160</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
strido: <entryFree id="n45578" type="main" key="stri_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strīdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. strideo.</entryFree>
stridor: <entryFree id="n45579" type="main" key="stri_dor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strīdor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>strideo</etym>, <sense id="n45579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">any harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hissing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grating</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">creaking sound; a creaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hissing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rattling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">buzzing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whizzing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whistling</hi>, etc. (class.; esp. freq. in the poets; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">strepitus, clangor): serpentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:287" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 287</bibl>: elephantorum, <cb n="STRI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 72:5" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 72, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:84:1" default="NO">84, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volant pinnarum stridore (locustae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 29, 35, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Troglodytis stridor, non vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 8, 8, § 45</bibl></cit>: horrifer Aquiloni' stridor, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 68</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 567 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne stridorem quidem serrae, cum acuitur (audiunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 116</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">id. poët. Div. 1, 7, 13: procellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit> (4, 6), 47: <cit><quote lang="la">rudentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 495</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">januae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:608" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 608</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 51, 112, § 267</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinnarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 29, 35, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lituum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena, quae manu confricata fecerit stridorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni plebis stridor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:26:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 26, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridor acutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:179" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 179</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consonantium tristior stridor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 37</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridores aurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 21, § 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stridulus: <entryFree id="n45580" type="main" key="stri_du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strīdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>strideo</etym>, <sense id="n45580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">creaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rattling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hissing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whizzing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">buzzing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stridulous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">stridula cornus (i. e. hasta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraxinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 3, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fax lacrimoso stridula fumo fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus monstri (i. e. elephanti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:627" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridula et tenuis vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 56:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 56, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">examina apum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Hon. 4, 380</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
striga: <entryFree id="n45581" type="main" key="stri^ga1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stringo</etym>. <sense id="n45581.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A row of grain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hay cut down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a swath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">windrow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18, 2</bibl>; cf. Fest. s. h. v. pp. 314 and 315. —</sense><sense id="n45581.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A furrow drawn lengthwise of the field</hi>, Jul. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Agr. p. 38" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Agr. p. 38</bibl>.—In a camp, <hi rend="ital">the spaces between the squadrons</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 1, p. 85</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45582" type="main" key="stri_ga2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strīga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. strix</etym>, a woman that brings harm to children, <sense id="n45582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">witch</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 63</bibl>; cf. Fest. s. v. strigem, p. 314 Müll.: striga, <foreign lang="greek">gunh\ farmaki/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
strigatus: <entryFree id="n45583" type="hapax" key="stri^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. strix</etym>, among surveyors: ager, <sense id="n45583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a field whose length</hi> (or measurement from north to south) <hi rend="ital">is greater than its breadth</hi> (opp. scamnatus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aggen.</author> p. 46</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
strigilecula: <entryFree id="n45584" type="hapax" key="stri^gi^le_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭgĭlēcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>strigilis</etym>, <sense id="n45584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small strigil</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 346, 27</bibl>; cf.: strigilecula, <foreign lang="greek">stleggi/dion</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
strigilis: <entryFree id="n45585" type="main" key="stri^gi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭgĭlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<sense id="n45585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> striglium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 4, 3</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> striglibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:263" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 263</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stringo</etym>. </sense><sense id="n45585.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a scraper</hi> (made of horn or metal) used by bathers for removing the impurities of the skin, <hi rend="ital">a strigil</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">stleggi/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 44</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 223, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:12:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 12, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:126" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 97:47" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 97, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:263" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 263</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:126" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 126</bibl>; cf. Becker, Gallus, 3, p. 86 (2d. ed.).— </sense><sense id="n45585.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45585.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A surgical instrument of a similar shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for dropping a liquid into the ear</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 103, § 164</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45585.4" n="B" level="2"> Among the Spaniards, <hi rend="ital">a small bit</hi> of native gold, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 19, § 62</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45585.5" n="C" level="2"> = stria, <hi rend="ital">the flute</hi> of a column, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strigmentum: <entryFree id="n45586" type="main" key="strigmentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strigmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n45586.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">that which is scratched</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scraped off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a scraping</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 3, 8, § 17</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n45586.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">filth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dirt scraped off</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 51, 74, § 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:51" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 4, 13, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 14</bibl>, ext. 2 al.</sense></entryFree>
strigo: <entryFree id="n45587" type="main" key="stri^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>2. strix</etym>. <sense id="n45587.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hold up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">halt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi> in ploughing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 177</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45587.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45587.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 31:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 31, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45587.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to give out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lose strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sink</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 8, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strigosus: <entryFree id="n45588" type="main" key="stri^go_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭgōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stringo</etym>, <sense id="n45588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meagre</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n45588.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: equum nimis strigosum et male habitum, sed equitem ejus uberrimum et habitissimum viderunt, Massur. Sabin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 11</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 168, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis (opp. obesus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: hic strigosus bovinatorque, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:7:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 7, 10</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 47</bibl></cit>: hinno strigosior, Maecen. ap. Suet. Vit. Hor. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(capella) strigosissimi corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45588.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of an orator, <hi rend="ital">meagre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tasteless</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 16, 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strigula: <entryFree id="n45589" type="main" key="stri^gu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭgŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = strigilis, I., Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:263" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 263</bibl>.</entryFree>
stringo: <entryFree id="n45590" type="main" key="stringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stringo</orth>, <itype>inxi, ictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root strig; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">stragg</foreign>-, to squeeze; <foreign lang="greek">stra/gc</foreign>, a drop; cf. O. H. Germ. streng; Engl. strong</etym>, <sense id="n45590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to draw tight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tie tight; to draw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bind</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">press together</hi>, etc. (syn. ligo). </sense><sense id="n45590.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">te stringam ad carnarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stringit vitta comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 143</bibl></cit>: caesariem <cb n="STRI" /> crinali cultu, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 85: <cit><quote lang="la">stricta matutino frigore vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora pigro gelu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:652" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 652</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strictos insedimus amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:414" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare gelu stringi et consistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus in duas partes diducta, stricta denuo et cohaesa,</quote> <trans><tr>having closed together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:16:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habenam,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw tight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:513" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 513</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 16, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45590.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (through the intermediate idea of drawing close), <hi rend="ital">to touch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touch upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touch lightly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to graze</hi> (syn. tango): <cit><quote lang="la">litus ama, et laevas stringat sine palmula cautes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 163</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stringebat summas ales miserabilis undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 733</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor (aurā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:136" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metas interiore rotā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit> (4, 10), 24: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia canis rostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 536</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <trans><tr>to stroke</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 84</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">tela stringentia corpus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>slightly touching</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 331</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:6:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coluber Dente pedem strinxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:776" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 776</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strictus ac recreatus ex vulnere in tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:44" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45590.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pull</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strip off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pluck off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clip off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prune</hi>, etc. (cf. destringo): <cit><quote lang="la">oleam ubi nigra erit, stringito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 65, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">oleam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 2, 3, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bacam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:55:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 55, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quernas glandes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia ex arboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 30, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeriter gladios strinxerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>drew from the sheath</tr>, <tr>unsheathed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strictam aciem offerre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 577</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">gladios,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 278</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 333</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:207" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 207</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">14, 296: ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 50, 3</bibl>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">manum,</quote> <trans><tr>to bare</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:30 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 30 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n45590.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45590.5" n="A" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">to touch upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treat briefly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:48" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 48</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">to compress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abridge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrationis loco rem stringat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:128" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 128</bibl></cit> Spald.—</sense><sense id="n45590.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hold in check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sway</hi> (syn. coërceo): <cit><quote lang="la">quaecumque meo gens barbara nutu Stringitur, adveniat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 371</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45590.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reduce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclaram stringat malus ingluvie rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45590.8" n="D" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B.) <hi rend="ital">To touch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affect;</hi> esp. <hi rend="ital">to affect painfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque animum patriae strinxit pietatis imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam tua delicto stringantur pectora nostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:6:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:350" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 350</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n45590.9" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To draw</hi> in hostility, <hi rend="ital">attack with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hostes stringatur iambus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">strictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I.), <hi rend="ital">drawn together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tight</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n45590.10" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">laxaret pedem a stricto nodo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duriora genti corpora, stricti artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strictissima janua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si strictior fuerit pedatura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Grom. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Grom. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emplastrum,</quote> <trans><tr>thick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 45" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venter,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>bound up</tr>, <tr>costive</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strictior aura,</quote> <trans><tr>more severe</tr>, <tr>colder</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 14, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45590.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45590.12" n="1" level="3"> Of language, <hi rend="ital">brief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo minus (Aeschines) strictus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Demosthenes) est strictior multo (quam Cicero),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45590.13" n="2" level="3"> Of character, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strict</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 769</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:87" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45590.14" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Rigid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exact</hi> (law Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">restitutio stricto jure non competebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:85" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 2, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:3:3 al" default="NO">39, 3, 3 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">strictē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">strictim</orth>, <hi rend="ital">closely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tightly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in foramen conicies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45590.15" n="2" level="3"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">accurately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">strictius interpretari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 2, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stringor: <entryFree id="n45591" type="hapax" key="stringor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stringor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>stringo</etym>, <sense id="n45591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a touching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidae aquaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 693</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
strio: <entryFree id="n45592" type="main" key="stri^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n45592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>stria</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to furnish with furrows</hi> or <hi rend="ital">channels; to hollow out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">groove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">striate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnas viginti striis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asparagum in toros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 42, § 146</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">concham,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 5, 11, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conchula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 297, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons striata,</quote> <trans><tr>wrinkled</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 10, p. 239, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45593" type="main" key="stri^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, rare collat. form of histrio, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 1</bibl>.</entryFree>
stritavus: <entryFree id="n45594" type="gloss" key="stri^ta^vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭtăvus</orth>, v. tritavus <sense id="n45594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
