strittabillae: <entryFree id="n45595" type="main" key="strittabillae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strittabillae</orth>, v. strictivilla.</entryFree>
strittare: <entryFree id="n45596" type="gloss" key="stritta_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strittāre</orth>, <sense id="n45596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be weak in the feet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">strittare ab eo, qui sistit aegre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=65" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 65</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
strix: <entryFree id="n45597" type="greek" key="strix1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strix</orth>, <itype>strĭgis</itype> (on the ĭ cf. Lachm. <pb n="1767" /> <cb n="STRU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:II. p. 36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> II. p. 36</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stri/gc</foreign> [from <foreign lang="greek">stri/zw, tri/zw</foreign>, the screecher], <sense id="n45597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a screech-owl</hi>, which, according to the belief of the ancients, sucked the blood of young children, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:133 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 133 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 39, 95, § 232</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:52" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 269</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 5, 17; 3 (4, 5), 6, 29; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 134, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=314:33" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 314, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45598" type="main" key="strix2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strix</orth>, <itype>ĭgis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a furrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">channel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">groove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">strigium circuitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 4</bibl> (al. striae; but cf. strigatus and strigo).</sense></entryFree>
strobilus: <entryFree id="n45599" type="greek" key="stro^bi^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŏbĭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stro/bilos</foreign>, <sense id="n45599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pine-nut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pine-cone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:55:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 55, § 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45600" type="main" key="Stro^bi_lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strŏbīlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strobus: <entryFree id="n45601" type="main" key="stro^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŏbus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">storbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n45601.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tree in Carmania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yielding an odoriferous gum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 40, § 79</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45601.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another name of the</hi> ladanum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 37, § 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stroma: <entryFree id="n45602" type="greek" key="stro_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">strw=ma</foreign>, <sense id="n45602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bedcovering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coverlet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 4, § 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45602.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">strōmăta</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">plur. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">miscellaneous writings</hi>, Hier. Prol. in Ep. Gal.</sense></entryFree>
stromateus: <entryFree id="n45603" type="main" key="Stro^ma^teus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strŏmăteus</orth>, <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">strwmateu/s</foreign>. <sense id="n45603.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">the writer of miscellanies</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">strw/mata</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a surname of Clemens of Alexandria</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Inst. Div. Litt. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45603.1" n="II" level="1"> = stromata (v. stroma, II.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 6, p. 696</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
strombus: <entryFree id="n45604" type="greek" key="strombus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strombus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">strombos</foreign>, <sense id="n45604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of spiral snail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 39, § 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:151" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strongyla: <entryFree id="n45605" type="greek" key="strongy^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strongyla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stroggu/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n45605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bust</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
strongyle: <entryFree id="n45606" type="greek" key="strongy^le_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strongylē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stroggu/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n45606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of alum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 52, § 187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45607" type="main" key="Strongy^le_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strongylē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stroggu/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n45607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Lipari islands</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Stromboli</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Or. Mar. 453</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 9, 14, § 93</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:259" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 259</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strongylion: <entryFree id="n45608" type="main" key="Strongy^li^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strongylĭon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*strogguli/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n45608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Grecian sculptor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 18, § 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stropha: <entryFree id="n45609" type="greek" key="stro^pha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŏpha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">strofh/</foreign>. <sense id="n45609.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A strophe</hi> in the chorus of the Greek and Roman dramas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; Victor. p. 2501 P.—</sense><sense id="n45609.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A trick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artifice</hi> (not ante-Aug.; and, as in Greek, mostly <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">verbosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 26:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 26, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 37</bibl> prooem.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ruf. 3, 14 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego aliquam stropham inveniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:7:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 7, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strophades: <entryFree id="n45610" type="main" key="Stro^pha^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strŏphădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*strofa)des</foreign>, <sense id="n45610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">two islands lying off the coast of Messenia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at first called Plotœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated as the fabled residence of the Harpies</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Strofahia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 210</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 709</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:513" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 513</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strophiarius: <entryFree id="n45611" type="hapax" key="stro^phi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŏphĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>strophium</etym>, <sense id="n45611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dealer in</hi> strophia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strophiolum: <entryFree id="n45612" type="main" key="stro^phi^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŏphĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small wreath</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chaplet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 2, 2, § 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strophium: <entryFree id="n45613" type="greek" key="stro^phi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŏphĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stro/fion</foreign> (a band). <sense id="n45613.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breast-band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>, worn by females under the breasts, Plaut., Turp., Varr., and Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 538, 7 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tereti strophio vincta papillas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a strophio, a psalterio, a flagitio, est factus, repente popularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:21:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 21, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: strophium est fascia brevis, quae virginalem tumorem cohibet papillarum, Non. l. l. —</sense><sense id="n45613.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A head-band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chaplet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Copa, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 26</bibl>; esp. of priests; cf. Fest. s. v. stroppus, p. 313 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n45613.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rope</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancoralia,</quote> <trans><tr>cables</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 265, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
strophius: <entryFree id="n45614" type="main" key="Stro^phi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strŏphĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stro/fios</foreign>, <sense id="n45614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Phocis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Pylades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:6:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 6, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strophoma: <entryFree id="n45615" type="greek" key="stro^pho_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŏphōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stro/fwma</foreign>, <sense id="n45615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the bellyache</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gripes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 13, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strophosus: <entryFree id="n45616" type="main" key="stro^pho_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŏphōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>strophus</etym>, <sense id="n45616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has the gripes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 57</bibl>; Ven. Carm. 8, 9, 17 (scanned strōphōsus).</sense></entryFree>
strophus: <entryFree id="n45617" type="greek" key="stro^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŏphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stro/fos</foreign>, <sense id="n45617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the bellyache</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gripes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 26</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 121" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 121</bibl>, and Fest. s. v. vermina, p. 375 Müll., written as Greek.).</sense></entryFree>
stroppus: <entryFree id="n45618" type="main" key="stroppus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stroppus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. struppus.</entryFree>
structe: <entryFree id="n45619" type="main" key="structe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">structē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. struo <sense id="n45619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
structilis: <entryFree id="n45620" type="main" key="structi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">structĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>struo</etym>, <sense id="n45620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to building; that is built</hi> or <hi rend="ital">constructed; that is designed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">used for building</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">canales,</quote> <trans><tr>walled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cloacae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bases,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:245" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 16, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:241" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 16, 241</bibl></cit>: <cb n="STRU" /> gemellar, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 10</bibl>: caementum, <hi rend="ital">building - cement</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that is used in building</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:76:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 76, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
structio: <entryFree id="n45621" type="main" key="structi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">structĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>struo</etym>, <sense id="n45621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">building</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">construction</hi> (postclass.). </sense><sense id="n45621.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">SCALARIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4570</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petrosolinum sternes inter spatia structionis (olivarum),</quote> <trans><tr>between the layers of the heap</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 22, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45621.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: arma venatoribus parabunt, ut retia, venabula, sagittas et quicquid ad structionem ejus studii pertinet, <hi rend="ital">apparatus</hi>, Firm. Math. 8, 9: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio et structio fidei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pat. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
structor: <entryFree id="n45622" type="main" key="structor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">structor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n45622.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who erects a building</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a builder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carpenter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res agebatur multis structoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 64, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 27 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n45622.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who spreads the table</hi> or <hi rend="ital">serves up food and carves; a server</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carver</hi> (post-Aug.): ferculorum compositor, Serv. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 703</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 35, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:120" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:136" default="NO">11, 136</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45622.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 365, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
structorius: <entryFree id="n45623" type="hapax" key="structo_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">structōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>structor</etym>, <sense id="n45623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to building</hi>, <hi rend="ital">architectural</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
structura: <entryFree id="n45624" type="main" key="structu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">structūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>struo</etym>, <sense id="n45624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fitting together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adaptation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjustment.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45624.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45624.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ossa in manu oblonga omnia et triangula, structurā quādam inter se conectuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membranarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 19, 34, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">togae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45624.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an architectural fitting together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a building</hi> or <hi rend="ital">erecting.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45624.4" n="1" level="3"> In abstr. (class.): parietum, <hi rend="ital">the mode of building</hi>, <hi rend="ital">construction</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">structurae antiquae genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 11</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">reticulata structura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 51, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(silex) globosus sed structurae infidelis,</quote> <trans><tr>for building</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 22, 49, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in structurā saxorum rudium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in structuris lapidum impolitorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45624.5" n="2" level="3"> In concr., <hi rend="ital">a building</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">edifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">structure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 123" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subterraneae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 50, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerariae structurae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>mining works</tr>, <tr>mines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (al. structuraeque).—</sense><sense id="n45624.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of language, <hi rend="ital">an arrangement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">structure</hi> (in Cic. only as a figure of speech, with quasi or quaedam; <cit><quote lang="la">later in gen.): verborum quasi structura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi structura quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 44, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et verborum est structura quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proprietates verborum exigit, et structuram et argumentationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 89:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 89, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mei carminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:13:4" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:27" default="NO">8, 5, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:67" default="NO">8, 6, 67</bibl>; 9, 4, 45; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
structus: <entryFree id="n45625" type="main" key="structus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">structus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. struo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45626" type="main" key="structus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">structus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>struo</etym>, <sense id="n45626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a heap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignorum structibus incensis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 15</bibl></cit> Hildeb.</sense></entryFree>
strues: <entryFree id="n45627" type="main" key="stru^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŭes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a heap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pile</hi> of things put together. </sense><sense id="n45627.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: acervus, cumulus, congeries): laterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 11, 22, § 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma cum telis in strue mixta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:1:40" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogi,</quote> <trans><tr>a funeral pile</tr>, <tr>pyre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:757" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 757</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 112" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oedip. 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 51</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">(milites Macedones) confusa strue implicantur,</quote> <trans><tr>a heap</tr>, <tr>mass</tr>, <tr>phalanx</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 41, 7</bibl></cit>.—Collect., with a verb in the <number>plur.</number>: LOCVS QVO EA STRVES CONGERANTVR, i. e. <hi rend="ital">piles of wood</hi>, Cenot. Pis. I. (in <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 642</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n45627.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">a heap of little offering-cakes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">strues genera liborum sunt, digitorum conjunctorum non dissimilia, qui superjecta panicula in transversum continentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=310" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 310</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. id. s. v. ferctum, p. 85; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 134, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">141, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:276" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 276</bibl>; Inscr. Fratr. Arv. ap. Marin. p. 403.</sense></entryFree>
strufertarii: <entryFree id="n45628" type="gloss" key="struferta_ri^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strufertārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">they who make offerings near a tree that has been struck by lightning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">strufertarios dicebant, qui quaedam sacrificia ad arbores fulguritas faciebant, a ferto scilicet, quodam sacrificii genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=295" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 295</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. id. s. v. ferctum, p. 85.</sense></entryFree>
struix: <entryFree id="n45629" type="main" key="struix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">struix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>struo</etym>, <sense id="n45629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a heap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pile</hi> of things put together (ante- and post-class. for the class. strues). </sense><sense id="n45629.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">struices antiqui dicebant exstructiones omnium rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=310" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 310</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">tantas struices concinnat patinarias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: et <cb n="STRU" /> Livius: <cit><quote lang="la">per struices saxeas lapsu accidit, Livius ap. Fest. l. l.: lignorum struicibus incensis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caementiciae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 28</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n45629.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: struix malorum, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 267</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 64 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
struma: <entryFree id="n45630" type="main" key="stru_ma1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>struo</etym>, <sense id="n45630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scrofulous tumor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">struma</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 9</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 206</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:38" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 14, 16, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:26 al" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 5, 14, § 26 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui exsecant pestem aliquam, tamquam strumam civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:65:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 65, 135</bibl></cit>; cf. sarcastically: Vatinii strumam sacerdotii <foreign lang="greek">diba/fw|</foreign> vestiant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45631" type="main" key="Stru_ma2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strūma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. struma</etym>, <sense id="n45631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 52, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 21, § 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strumaticus: <entryFree id="n45632" type="hapax" key="stru_ma_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūmātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a struma</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scrofulous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strumous</hi>, Firm. Math. 8, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
strumea: <entryFree id="n45633" type="main" key="stru_me^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūmĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. herba) [id.], <sense id="n45633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an herb that cures the struma</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 109, § 174</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strumella: <entryFree id="n45634" type="hapax" key="stru_mella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūmella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small struma</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 15 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
strumentum: <entryFree id="n45635" type="main" key="stru_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = instrumentum, aeternitatis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 1, 7</bibl>.</entryFree>
strumosus: <entryFree id="n45636" type="main" key="stru_mo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. struma</etym>, <sense id="n45636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a struma</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scrofulous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strumous</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:10:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:309" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 309</bibl></cit>: facies, Schol. Bob. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strumus: <entryFree id="n45637" type="main" key="stru_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant that cures the struma</hi>, called also strychnos and cuculus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 44, § 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
struo: <entryFree id="n45638" type="main" key="stru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŭo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root <foreign lang="greek">stor</foreign>; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">strw/nnumi</foreign>, to spread; cf. Sanscr. upa-star, to make ready; and v. sterno</etym>, <sense id="n45638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to place by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon each other; to pile up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n45638.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45638.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (rare but class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">condo, compono): quasi structa et nexa verbis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:41:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 41, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lateres, qui super musculo struantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altaque congestos struxisse ad sidera montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores in pyram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:231" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugem ordine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 677</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordine longo penum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 704</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:279" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 279</bibl>; hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">altaria donis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acervum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congeriem armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes, rem,</quote> <trans><tr>to heap up</tr>, <tr>accumulate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 120, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:44" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 44</bibl>: PEDEM, <hi rend="ital">to heap up steps</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to flee</hi>: SI CALVITVR PEDEMVE STRVIT MANVM ENDOIACITO, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:313" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 313</bibl> Müll.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: aliae (apes) struunt, aliae poliunt, aliae suggerunt, <hi rend="ital">pile up</hi> (the comb), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 22</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45638.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45638.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make by joining together; to build</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fabricate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">construct</hi> (syn. aedifico): <cit><quote lang="la">fornacem bene struito ... lateribus summam (fornacem) struito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 38, 1</bibl></cit> and 3: per speluncas saxis structas, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 37</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 208 Rib.); imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 195</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">templa saxo structa vetusto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia saxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:811" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 811</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentem pyram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 215</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 240</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:295" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubas,</quote> <trans><tr>to make</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 20: <cit><quote lang="la">cubilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:841" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 841</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia,</quote> <trans><tr>to get ready</tr>, <tr>prepare</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 37</bibl></cit> et saep.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">reticulata structura, quā frequentissime Romae struunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 51, § 172</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxorum structa,</quote> <trans><tr>masonry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 361</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45638.5" n="2" level="3"> With the idea of order predominating, <hi rend="ital">to set in order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias ante frontem castrorum struit,</quote> <trans><tr>arranges</tr>, <tr>draws up in rank and file</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 37</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 42</bibl>: omnes armatos in campo, Liv 42, 51.—</sense><sense id="n45638.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45638.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to join together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex praepositione et duobus vocabulis dure videtur struxisse Pacuvius, Nerei repandirostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45638.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45638.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To prepare</hi> something detrimental; <hi rend="ital">to cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion; to devise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigate</hi>, etc. (very freq., esp. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">struunt sorores Atticae dirum nefas, Poët. ap. Mar. Vict. p. 2596 P. (Trag. Rel. p. 272 Rib.): aliquid calamitatis struere et moliri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 64, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sycophantias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num me fefellit hosce id struere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudinem sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium in alios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:51:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 51, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia recuperandi regni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 198</bibl>: periculum ruinae, Caecin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 10:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina et accusatores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: ultroque struebantur qui monerent perfugere ad Germaniae exercilus,<pb n="1768" /> <cb n="STUB" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversiam de nomine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 28, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid struit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid struis?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 271</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45638.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regulate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:43:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 43, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene structa collocatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:70:232" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 70, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: orationem solutam, Prob. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum proxima dicimus, struere ulteriora possimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid parum structum (in oratione),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 100:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 100, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum varios struerem per saecula reges,</quote> <trans><tr>ordained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:535" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 535</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45638.11" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To fit out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide with</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quot steriles utriusque naturae infructuosis genitalibus structi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo autem spiritu structus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Prax. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verg. Vel. 9</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">structē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">orderly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">methodically</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">historiam scripsere Sallustius structe, Pictor incondite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Ver. 1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Ver. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nobis causa est structius prodeundi?</quote> <trans><tr>with more embellishment</tr>, <tr>more ornately</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
struppearia: <entryFree id="n45639" type="gloss" key="struppe^a_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">struppĕārĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. struppus.</entryFree>
struppus: <entryFree id="n45640" type="main" key="struppus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">struppus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">stroppus</orth>; <sense id="n45640.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">stro/fion</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">a band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strap</hi> (anteclass.): remos jussit religare struppis, Liv. And. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 3, 6</bibl>: struppis verberari, Gracch. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 5</bibl>: stroppus est, ut Ateius Philologus existimat, quod Graece <foreign lang="greek">stro/fion</foreign> vocatur, et quod sacerdotes pro insigni habent in capite. Quidam coronam esse dicunt, aut quod pro coronā insigne in caput imponatur, quale sit strophium. Itaque apud Faliscos diem festum esse, qui vocetur struppearia, quia coronati ambulent; <cit><quote lang="la">et a Tusculanis, quod in pulvinari imponatur Castoris, struppum vocari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=313" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 313</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuioribus (coronis) utebantur antiqui, stroppos appellantes: unde nata strophiola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 2, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
strutheus: <entryFree id="n45641" type="greek" key="stru_the^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūthĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">strūthĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">strou/qios</foreign>, <sense id="n45641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to sparrows</hi>: mala (<hi rend="ital">sparrow-apples</hi>), a particular kind of apples, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 11, 10, § 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">strutheum in mimis praecipue vocant obscenam partem virilem, a salacitate videlicet passeris, qui Graece struthos dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=313" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 313</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
struthio: <entryFree id="n45642" type="main" key="stru_thi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūthĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. struthiocamelus.</entryFree>
struthiocamelinus: <entryFree id="n45643" type="greek" key="stru_thi^o^ca^me_li^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūthĭŏcămēlĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">strouqiokamh/linos</foreign>, <sense id="n45643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an ostrich</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 5, 30, § 96</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
struthiocamelus: <entryFree id="n45644" type="greek" key="stru_thi^o^ca^me_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūthĭŏcămēlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 56, § 155</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">strouqioka/mhlos</foreign>, <sense id="n45644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ostrich</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 1, 1, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:56" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 22, 29, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:130" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 47, § 130</bibl> (Jahn, struthocamelus); <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 137, 5 al.</bibl>—By later writers also called simply <orth extent="full" lang="la">strūthĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">strouqi/wn</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 30</bibl>; Vopisc. Firm. 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 11, 16</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
struthion: <entryFree id="n45645" type="greek" key="struthi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">struthĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">strouqi/on</foreign>, <sense id="n45645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soapwort</hi>: Saponaria officinalis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 18, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:96 al" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 11, 58, § 96 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
struthopus: <entryFree id="n45646" type="main" key="stru_tho^pu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūthŏpūs</orth>, <itype>pŏdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">strouqo/pous</foreign>, <sense id="n45646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sparrow-footed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">having small feet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strychnos: <entryFree id="n45647" type="greek" key="strychnos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strychnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stru/xnos</foreign>, <sense id="n45647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of nightshade</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 44, § 68</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">trychnos</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 177</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strymon: <entryFree id="n45648" type="main" key="Stry_mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strȳmon</orth> (<case>nom.</case> Strymo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1 praef.</bibl> <sense id="n45648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 38</bibl>), ŏnis and ŏnos (<case>acc.</case> Strymona, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 10, 12, § 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Strymonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:44:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 44, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:29" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 29</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*strumw/n</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n45648.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The river Strymon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Thrace</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Struma</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Kara-su</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 2</bibl> and 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:27" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 10, 12, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 508</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 257</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:44:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 44, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 4, 72 al.—Many cranes lived upon its banks, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 199</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 476</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45648.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:188" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 188</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n45648.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Strȳmŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Strymon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Strymonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">grues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 265</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called grex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:30:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 30, 8</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi> or <hi rend="ital">northern</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:602" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 602</bibl></cit>: Arctos. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:526" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 526</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 479" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 479</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45648.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Strȳ-mŏnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Thrace; subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Thracian woman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis Strymonis abscisso fertur aperta sinu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Amazon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 72.</sense></entryFree>
stubera: <entryFree id="n45649" type="main" key="Stubera"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stubera</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:18" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:19" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 19</bibl>. <cb n="STUD" /></sense></entryFree>
studeo: <entryFree id="n45650" type="main" key="stu^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭdĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype> (<sense id="n45650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> studīvi, M. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 5</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perh. kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">speu/dw, spoudh/</foreign>, to speed, haste</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to be eager</hi> or <hi rend="ital">zealous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take pains about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be diligent in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxious about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">busy one's self with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strive after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to apply one's self to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pursue</hi> some course of action, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to desire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wish</hi>, etc. (very freq. and class.; cf.: operam do). </sense><sense id="n45650.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n45650.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (very rare), Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:10:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 10, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aequum fuerat atque ut studui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: si qui in eā re studebat, etc., Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:2:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 2, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45650.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (rare; mostly with <hi rend="ital">neutr. pronn.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>): horum ille nihil egregie Studebat; <cit><quote lang="la">et tamen omnia haec mediocriter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud ipsum, quod studet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspexi ex tuis litteris, quod semper studui, me a te plurimi fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenonem perjurum ut perdas id studes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 72</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">id, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:56:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 56, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum studetis Antonii conatum avertere a re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc unum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 120</bibl></cit>.—With a <hi rend="ital">defin. obj.</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">minus has res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: res Graecas, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 629</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n45650.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <case>acc.</case> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">si merito meo referre studeant gratias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum audire ex te studeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo studeo ex te audire quod sentias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:11:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 11, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scire studeo, quid egeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studemus, nostris consiliis tutiorem vitam hominum reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fieri studebam ejus prudentiā doctior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc acerbitate opprimere studuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portum intrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Chabr. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego me id facere studeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quisquam est, qui placere se studeat bonis Quam plurimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illis gratum se videri studet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 20, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te sociam studeo scribendis versibus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes homines, qui sese student praestare ceteris animalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque est, cur nunc studeam, has nuptias mutarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem ad arma deduci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; Matt. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 28, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45650.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (so most freq. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi rei studet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">huic rei studendum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iisdem rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra aut pecuniae, aut imperiis, aut opibus, aut gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtuti, laudi, dignitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:24:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 24, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agriculturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 22</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 29: sacrificiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:93:322" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 93, 322</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui scientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui arti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commodis communibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:19" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectis sternendis studuimus munditiisque apparandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armamentis complicandis et componendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonio augendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juri et legibus cognoscendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revocandis regibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:9:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—* (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: parens, qui te nec amet nec studeat tui, <hi rend="ital">troubles himself about you</hi>, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 72</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 201 Rib.).— (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar maxime studebat, ut partem oppidi excluderet, Auct. B. Alex. 1, 4: ut habeas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 10, 1</bibl>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne solus esset, studui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2</bibl></cit>, epil. 6: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">In aliquid</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">in quam rem studendum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam pictores in id solum student, ut sciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45650.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45650.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be zealous</hi> for any one, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be friendly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attached</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi> to one, <hi rend="ital">to favor</hi> him (syn. favere). </sense><sense id="n45650.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut studeat tibi, ut te adjuvet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 36, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homini nequam atque improbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catilinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (with favere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (partibus) illi student,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 27, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnullae civitates rebus Cassii studebant, Auct. B. Alex. 62, 2: rebus Atheniensium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petitioni alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45650.9" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque studere neque odisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45650.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To apply one's self to learning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to study</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be diligent</hi> in study (only post-Aug.; for which in Cic. litteris, arti, etc.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, I. A. <foreign lang="greek">d</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">computamus annos, non quibus studuimus, sed quibus viximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:7:1" default="NO">2, 7, 1</bibl>: Demosthenes diligenter apud Andronicum studuit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 7</bibl>: aliquem a proposito studendi fugare, id. <cb n="STUD" /> 2, 2, 7: non est, quod post cibum studeas. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo, qui apud Chaldaeos studuisse se dicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 7, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negat enim te studere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studes an piscaris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; 2, 13, 5; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 5, 18: solacium studendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videtur mihi inter Menenios et Appios studuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 21</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 32</bibl>; 34.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭ-dens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a diligent student</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in habitu studentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
studiolum: <entryFree id="n45651" type="main" key="stu^di^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭdĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>studium</etym>. * <sense id="n45651.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little study</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little piece of composition</hi>, M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45651.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little study</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a little room</hi> or <hi rend="ital">closet to study in</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 937, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
studiose: <entryFree id="n45652" type="main" key="stu^di^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭdĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. studiosus <sense id="n45652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
studiosus: <entryFree id="n45653" type="main" key="stu^di^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭdĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>studium</etym>, <sense id="n45653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">zealous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assiduous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxious</hi> after any thing, <hi rend="ital">fond</hi> or <hi rend="ital">studious</hi> of any thing. </sense><sense id="n45653.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n45653.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">venandi aut pilae studiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemorum caedisque ferinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 675</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culinae aut Veneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 27, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 251</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summe omnium doctrinarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">musices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 2; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 1, 19: sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <trans><tr>occupied with</tr>, <tr>studious of</tr>, <tr>the law</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 32</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille restituendi mei quam retinendi studiosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">munditiarum lautitiarumque studiosissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aleae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 1" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45653.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi adulterio, studiosus rei nulli aliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum quam conviviorum apparatibus studiosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:8:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45653.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiosiores ad opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45653.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in argento,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 52, 1</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo valde studiosus ac diligens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putavi mihi suscipiendum laborem utilem studiosis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid studioso animo inchoare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 16, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45653.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45653.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Zealous</hi> for any one, i. e. <hi rend="ital">partial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friendly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attached</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devoted</hi> to him (class.;
