esp. freq. in Cic.): omnem omnibus studiosis ac fautoribus illius victoriae <foreign lang="greek">parrhsi/an</foreign> eripui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mei studiosos habeo Dyrrhachinos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 16, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 40, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiosa Pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:91" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 91</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiosior alterius partis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te studiosiorem in me colendo fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 19, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc cum ejus studiosissimo Pammene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:30:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 30, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimationis meae studiosissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:47:section=117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 47, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiosissimum Platonis auditorem fuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45653.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Devoted to study</hi> or <hi rend="ital">learning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">learned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">studious</hi> (not anteAug.; in Cic. always with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: litterarum, doctrinarum, etc.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, I. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>, and cf. studeo, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid studiosa cohors operum struit?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse est studiosus, litteratus, etiam disertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis studiosus alioquin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 32</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">studiosa disputatio,</quote> <trans><tr>a learned disputation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 22, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭdĭōsi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">studious men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the learned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">students</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:45" default="NO">10, 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 13, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 28, 2</bibl>.—Also, <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stŭdĭōsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">The Student</hi>, the title of a work of the elder Pliny, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 5</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭ-dĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">eagerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">zealously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">studiously</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">texentem telam studiose offendimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum studiose pila luderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:62:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 62, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libenter studioseque audire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 12, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid studiose diligenterque curare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, A, § <cit><quote lang="la">7: studiose discunt, diligenter docentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid investigare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:11:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 11, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiose cavendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 99</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego cum antea studiose commendabam Marcilium, tum multo nunc studiosius, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:61" default="NO">3, 6, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:578" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 578</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:3:5 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 3, 5 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid studiosissime quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 10, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:28:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 28, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
studium: <entryFree id="n45654" type="main" key="stu^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>studeo</etym>, <sense id="n45654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a busying one's self about</hi> or <hi rend="ital">application to</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">assiduity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">zeal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eagerness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fondness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exertion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endeavor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">study</hi>: stu <pb n="1769" /> <cb n="STUD" /> dium est animi assidua et vehemens ad aliquam rem applicata magnā cum voluntate occupatio, ut philosophiae, poëticae, geometriae, litterarum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:25:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 25, 36</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n45654.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n45654.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 900</bibl> P. (Praecepta, v. 4 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">tantum studium tamque multam operam in aliquā re ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid curare studio maximo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem retrahere ab studio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium semper assit, cunctatio absit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid summo studio curāque discere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; so (with cura, industria, labor, diligentia, etc.) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 1, 3: alacritate ac studio uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studio incendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 17, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1, § 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo quisque studio maxime ducitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quot capitum vivunt, totidem studiorum Milia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt pueritiae certa studia, sunt ineuntis adulescentiae ... sunt extrema quaedam studia senectutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:20:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 20, 76</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">non studio accusare sed officio defendere,</quote> <trans><tr>with zeal</tr>, <tr>from inclination</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:32:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 32, 91</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laedere gaudes, et hoc studio pravus facis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 79</bibl></cit>.—In late Lat. studio often means simply <hi rend="ital">voluntarily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intentionally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non studio sed fortuitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:5:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45654.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: studiumque iteris reprime, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 485, 8</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 627 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">in pugnae studio quod dedita mens est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthaginienses ad studium fallendi studio quaestus vocabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">efferor studio patres vestros videndi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 23, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ego de studiis dicam cognoscendi semper aliquid atque discendi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27, 104</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">discendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 22, 36 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: vitae studium, <hi rend="ital">way of life</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 498, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium armorum a manibus ad oculos translatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:13:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 13, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45654.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> (usu. to avoid multiplying genitives): <cit><quote lang="la">ea res studia hominum adcendit ad consulatum mandandum Ciceroni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium ad frugalitatem multitudines provocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:4:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45654.5" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45654.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Zeal</hi> for any one; <hi rend="ital">good-will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attachment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devotion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindness</hi>, etc. (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">officium, favor): tibi profiteor atque polliceor eximium et singulare meum studium in omni genere officii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium et favor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 10, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">studio ac suffragio suo viam sibi ad beneficium impetrandum munire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius significat studium erga me non mediocre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum infelix erga populum Romanum studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 56, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omne suum erga meam dignitatem studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:56:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 56, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium in aliquem habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:34:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 34, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gaditani ab omni studio sensuque Poenorum mentes suas ad nostrum imperium nomenque flexerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium suum in rempublicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 49, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium in populum Romanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiis odiisque carens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putabatur et Marius studia volgi amissurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 84:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 84, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid studio partium facere,</quote> <trans><tr>party spirit</tr>, <tr>partisanship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:13:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 13, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">for which simply studium: quo minus cupiditatis ac studii visa est oratio habere, eo plus auctoritatis habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus, in quo ipso erant studia,</quote> <trans><tr>party efforts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultio senatum in studia diduxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45654.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Application to learning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">studying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">study;</hi> in the <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">studies</hi> (very freq.; also in Cic.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">studeo and studiosus): pabulum studii atque doctrinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(eum) non solum naturā et moribus, verum etiam studio et doctrinā esse sapientem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper mihi et doctrina et eruditi homines et tua ista studia placuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia Graecorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:18:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 18, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum se et hominibus Pythagoreis et studiis illis dedisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relinque te studiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia ad voluptatem exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 6:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam ex studiis petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 6:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Polyb. 18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Polyb. 18</bibl> (36), 1: studia graviora iracundis omittenda sunt, id. Ira, 3, 9, 1; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">studiis annos septem dedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non Intendes animum studiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2</bibl></cit>, <cb n="STUL" /> 36: o seri studiorum! i. e. <foreign lang="greek">o)yimaqei=s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 21</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n45654.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45654.9" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The fruits of study</hi>, <hi rend="ital">works</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">flagitante vulgo ut omnia sua studia publicaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45654.10" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A place for study</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a study</hi>, <hi rend="ital">school</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">philosophum (se egit) in omnibus studiis, templis, locis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aurel. 26</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 14, 9, 3.</sense></entryFree>
stulte: <entryFree id="n45655" type="main" key="stulte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stultē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. stultus <sense id="n45655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
stultifico: <entryFree id="n45656" type="main" key="stulti^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stultĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>stultus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n45656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn into foolishness</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Orig. in Jer. Hom. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
stultiloquentia: <entryFree id="n45657" type="hapax" key="stulti^lo^quenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stultĭlŏquentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stultiloquus</etym>, <sense id="n45657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">silly talk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">babbling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stultiloquence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 185</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stultiloquium: <entryFree id="n45658" type="hapax" key="stulti^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stultĭlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">silly talk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">babbling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stultiloquy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Eph. 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eph. 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stultiloquus: <entryFree id="n45659" type="main" key="stulti^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stultĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stultusloquor</etym>, <sense id="n45659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">talking foolishly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">babbling</hi> (anteand post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tace stultiloque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: ignoratio, Hilar. Trin. 10, 65.</sense></entryFree>
stultitia: <entryFree id="n45660" type="main" key="stulti^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stultĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stultus</etym>, <sense id="n45660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">folly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foolishness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simplicity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatuity</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">delirationem incredibilem! Non enim omnis error stultitia dicenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:43:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 43, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitia atque insipientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inscitiae meae et stultitiae ignoscas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum stultitiā facere ego hunc an malitiā Dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitiā ac temeritate vestrā Galliam prosternere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitia loquax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:35:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 35, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num tibi aut stultitia accessit aut superat superbia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitia atque arrogantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">3: stultitia est, ei te esse tristem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:82 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 82 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">esse enim stultitiam nolle sumere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est proprium stultitiae aliorum vitia cernere, oblivisci suorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:30:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 30, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus istius facti stultitiam alia jam superior stultitia defendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitiae peccatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:124 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 124 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitiamque meum crimen debere vocari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:6:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meae Stultitiam patiuntur opes,</quote> <trans><tr>extravagance</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 29</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of <hi rend="ital">folly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weakness</hi>, etc., in love: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicatum venio ob stultitiam meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitiae adulescentiae ejus ignoscas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum ineptias ac stultitias, quae devorandae nobis sunt, non ferebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:236" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 67, 236</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stultividus: <entryFree id="n45661" type="hapax" key="stulti^vi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stultĭvĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stultusvideo</etym>, <sense id="n45661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">simple-sighted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that sees things in a foolish light</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stultus: <entryFree id="n45662" type="main" key="stultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root star-; v. stolidus</etym>, <sense id="n45662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foolish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatuous</hi>, etc. (cf.: insulsus, ineptus, insipiens, brutus). </sense><sense id="n45662.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">stulti, stolidi, fatui, fungi, bardi, blenni, buccones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inepte stultus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier stulta atque inscita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex stultis insanos facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: deum qui non summum putet, stultum (existumat), Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:32:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 32, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vero te non stultum ut saepe, non improbum, ut semper, sed dementem et insanum, rebus vincam necessariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:1:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 4, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o stultos Camillos, Curios, Fabricios!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 24, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: stultus est, qui cupida cupiens cupienter cupit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 91, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut ego feci stultus! contrivi diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vel non stultus quasi stulte cum sale dicat aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:68:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 68, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ait Caecilius comicos, stultos senes, hos significat credulos, obliviosos, dissolutos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 11, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi sis stultior stultissimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultior stulto fuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 3, 19</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stultus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a fool</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stulto intellegens quid interest!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultorum plena sunt omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux stultorum festa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:513" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 513</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stultorum feriae appellabantur Quirinalia, quod eo die sacrificabant hi, qui solenni die aut non potuerunt rem divinam facere aut ignoraverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=316" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 316</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n45662.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things concrete and abstract: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla est tam stulta civitas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:18:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 18, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultā ac barbarā arrogantiā elati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:10:4" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cb n="STUP" /> gloria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 17, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>foolishly spent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:34" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 15:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 15, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 746</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium stultissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:23:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 23, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:16:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:86:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 86, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cavere possis, stultum admittere est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid autem stultius quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 8, 22</bibl> (v. in the foll.).—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stultē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">foolishly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sillily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stulte facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dupliciter stulte dicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 45</bibl></cit> M¨ll.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid stultius, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultius atque intemperantius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 13, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec et dicuntur et creduntur stultissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:28:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 28, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stupa: <entryFree id="n45663" type="main" key="stu_pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stūpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. stuppa.</entryFree>
stupefacio: <entryFree id="n45664" type="main" key="stu^pe^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭpĕ-făcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>stupeo</etym>, <sense id="n45664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make stupid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">senseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to benumb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deaden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupefy</hi> (rare; usu. in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n45664.1" n="(a)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">verb. fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">privatos luctus stupefecit publicus pavor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:122" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 122</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nostro stupefiat Cynthia versu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit> (3, 4), 7.—</sense><sense id="n45664.2" n="(b)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupefied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stunned</hi>: quem stupefacti dicentem intuentur? * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectas tuam stupefacta figuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenti motu stupefactus aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 365</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 547" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 547</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:633" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 633</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:228" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 228</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stupefio: <entryFree id="n45665" type="main" key="stu^pe^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭpĕfīo</orth>, <itype>factus</itype>, v. stupefacio.</entryFree>
stupeo: <entryFree id="n45666" type="main" key="stu^peo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭpeo</orth>, <itype>ui, ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n45666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [Sanscr. stūpas, cumulus; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">stu/pos</foreign>; Lat. stipes, a block, stump; cf. <foreign lang="greek">stei/bw</foreign>]. </sense><sense id="n45666.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be struck senseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be stunned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benumbed; to be struck aghast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be astonished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">astounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amazed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupefied</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. torpeo): animus lassus curā confectus stupet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hic etiam tum semisomnus, stupri plenus stuperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:36:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 36, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpescunt scorpiones aconiti tactu stupentque pallentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum loqueris, nos barones stupemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:23:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 23, 77</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum intuerer stupens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum stupet obtutuque haeret defixus in uno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admiror, stupeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:63:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 63, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc in oppidis coartatus et stupens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigiles attoniti et stupentibus similes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:2:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni capti et stupentes animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45666.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> with <case>abl.</case>: stupere gaudio Graecus, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectatione stupere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carminibus stupens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupet Albius aere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 621" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 621</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex subito malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui stupet in titulis et imaginibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupet in Turno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 446</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n45666.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater ad auditas stupuit voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 509</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et stupet ad raptus Tyndaris ipsa tuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:52:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 52, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad supervacua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tam saevam dominationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 26, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45666.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate or abstract things, <hi rend="ital">to be benumbed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stiffened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be brought to a stand-still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stop</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): multum refert, a fonte bibatur Qui fluit, an pigro quae stupet unda lacu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:100:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 100, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina brumā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:603" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 603</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 763" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 763</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad frigus stupet (vinum), opp. gelascit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 21, 27, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupuitque Ixionis orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignavo stupuerunt verba palato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 6, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupente ita seditione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45666.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be astonished</hi> or <hi rend="ital">amazed at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wonder at</hi> any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">admiror): pars stupet innuptae donum exitiale Minervae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia dum stupet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:96" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regis delicias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:15:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum omnia stupeo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 29 al.</bibl></cit>— Hence, <hi rend="ital">part. fut. pass.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭpendus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">wonderful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">astonishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amazing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupendous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutibus stupendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutum stupenda penetralia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. Const. 6, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stupesco: <entryFree id="n45667" type="main" key="stu^pesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭpesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n45667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [stupeo], <hi rend="ital">to grow astonished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become amazed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:32:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 32, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stupeus: <entryFree id="n45668" type="main" key="stu_pe^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stūpĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. stuppeus.</entryFree>
stupiditas: <entryFree id="n45669" type="main" key="stu^pi^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭpĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stupidus</etym>, <sense id="n45669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">senselessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dullness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupidity</hi> (very rare), Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 226, 22</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 287 Rib.): incredibilis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:32:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 32, 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stupido: <entryFree id="n45670" type="main" key="stu^pi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭpĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to confound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amaze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">astonish</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pavidum vulgus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 572</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, § 725</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stupidus: <entryFree id="n45671" type="main" key="stu^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stupeo</etym>, <sense id="n45671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">struck</hi> <pb n="1770" /> <cb n="STUP" /> <hi rend="ital">senseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amazed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45671.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">stupida sine animo asto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid stas stupida? quid taces?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupidi timore obmutuerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 52, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Echionis tabula te stupidum detinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 2, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">populus studio stupidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:prol. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. prol. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45671.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45671.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Senseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foolish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stolid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zopyrus physiognomon stupidum esse Socratem dixit et bardum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:7:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aur. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:197" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 197</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 239</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: homo, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 400, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45671.4" n="B" level="2"> Of things: colles, i. e. <hi rend="ital">not susceptible of tillage</hi>, Ven. Carm. 3, 12, 39.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> seems not to occur.</sense></entryFree>
stupor: <entryFree id="n45672" type="main" key="stu^por"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭpor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>stupeo</etym>, <sense id="n45672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">numbness; dulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insensibility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupidity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupefaction; astonishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wonder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amazement</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. torpor): stupor in corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:6:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensūs stupor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:45:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 45, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupor obstitit lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:29" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: stupor omnium animos tenet. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos stupor urget inertes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 523</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupor cordis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupor debilitasque linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantus te stupor oppressit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:26:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 26, 65</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum stupor silentiumque ceteros patrum defixisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupor omnes et admiratio incessit, unde tam subitum bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:7" default="NO">12, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> II. Cons. Stil. 344</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45672.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">dulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupidity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stolidity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae mandata! quā adrogantiā! Quo stupore!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stuporem hominis, vel dicam pecudis, attendite ... Sit in verbis tuis hic stupor: quanto in rebus sententiisque major,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quis stupor hic, Menelae, fuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 361</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, for stupidus, <hi rend="ital">a fool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simpleton</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">talis iste meus stupor nil videt, nihil audit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum demum ingemuit corvi deceptus stupor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 13, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stuporatus: <entryFree id="n45673" type="hapax" key="stu^po_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭpōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stupor</etym>, <sense id="n45673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">regarded with amazement</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wonder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stuppa: <entryFree id="n45674" type="greek" key="stuppa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stuppa</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">stūpa, stī-pa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stu/pph</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">stu/ph</foreign>), <sense id="n45674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the coarse part of flax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oakum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 3, § 17</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:880" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 880</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 682</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:135" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 135</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=317" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 317</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
stupparius: <entryFree id="n45675" type="hapax" key="stuppa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stuppārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">stūpār-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stuppa</etym>, <sense id="n45675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to tow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tow-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malleus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 3, § 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stuppeus: <entryFree id="n45676" type="main" key="stuppe^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stuppĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">stūpĕus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consisting of tow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retinacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 547</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbera fundae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <trans><tr>burning tow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 694</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">messis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>flax</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stuprator: <entryFree id="n45677" type="main" key="stu_^pra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stū^prātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>stupro</etym>, <sense id="n45677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a defiler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">debaucher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravisher</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:42" default="NO">7, 4, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 896" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 896</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 229, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stupre: <entryFree id="n45678" type="hapax" key="stu_^pre_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stū^prē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>stuprum</etym>, <sense id="n45678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shamefully</hi>: foede stupreque castigor cottidie, Neleus ap. Fest. s. v. stuprum, p. 317 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
stupro: <entryFree id="n45679" type="main" key="stu_^pro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stū^pro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to defile.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45679.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pulvinar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stuprandis moribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45679.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to dishonor</hi> by unchastity, <hi rend="ital">to debauch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deflour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stuprate</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui illam stupravit noctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne stupraretur (filia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:22:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 22, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucretia vi stuprata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 22, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simillimi feminis mares stuprati et constupratores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 15, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenuum stupravit et stupratus se suspendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stuprosus: <entryFree id="n45680" type="hapax" key="stu_^pro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stū^prōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unchaste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">debauched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrupt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1</bibl></cit>, n. 8.</sense></entryFree>
stuprum: <entryFree id="n45681" type="main" key="stu_^prum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stū^prum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n45681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">defilement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45681.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (so only ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">stuprum pro turpitudine antiquos dixisse apparet in Appii sententiis: qui animi compotem esse, ne quid fraudis stuprique ferocia pariat. Naevius: seseque ii perire mavolunt ibidem, quam cum stupro redire ad suos populares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=317" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 317</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n45681.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi> by unchastity of any sort, <hi rend="ital">debauchery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lewdness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violation</hi>, always implying the infliction of dishonor on the subject, whether male or female, not used of dealings with prostitutes,<cb n="STYP" />  etc. (opp. pudicitia; cf.: adulterium, incestum; class.): conjugem inlexe in stuprum, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:26:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 26, 68</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 205 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi quis pudenda queritur, ut stuprum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:84" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probri, stupri, dedecoris argutam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupra et corruptelae et adulteria, incesta denique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:35:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 35, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nefarium stuprum non per illum (factum)?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupri plenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum stuprum Bonae Deae pulvinaribus intulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:39:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 39, 95</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stuprum reginae intulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 9, 38</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quamcumque in domum stuprum intulerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:2:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 3, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(eum) cum germanā sorore nefarium stuprum fecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 27, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat ei cum Fulviā stupri vetus consuetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui primo ingentis sumptus stupro corporis toleraverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 24, 3</bibl></cit>: rapere ad stuprum virgines matronasque, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 456, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiae stupro violatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullis polluitur casta domus stupris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupri mercede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 529</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor stupri tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 704</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matronas ad populum stupri damnatas pecuniā multavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 31, 9</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; 32, 21; 39, 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:84" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stuprum saevi pati tyranni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 302" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lacedaemonii ipsi omnia concedunt in amore juvenum, praeter stuprum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:4:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:6:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 6, 6</bibl>.—Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 3</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., for the person committing it: <cit><quote lang="la">una Clytemnestrae stuprum vehit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the paramour</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 57.</sense></entryFree>
stura: <entryFree id="n45682" type="main" key="Stura"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stura</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Cisalpine Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that flows into the Po near Turin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sturii: <entryFree id="n45683" type="main" key="Sturii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sturii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German tribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who held an island in the Rhine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 15, 29, § 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sturium: <entryFree id="n45684" type="main" key="Sturium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sturium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n45684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Mediterranean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the coast of Gaul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sturnini: <entryFree id="n45685" type="main" key="Sturni_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sturnīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Calabria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sturninus: <entryFree id="n45686" type="main" key="sturni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sturnīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sturnus</etym>, <sense id="n45686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speckled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like a starling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 66, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sturnus: <entryFree id="n45687" type="main" key="sturnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sturnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ya/r</foreign>; mod. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">yaro/ni</foreign>; Germ. star; Engl. star-ling</etym>, <sense id="n45687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a starling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stare</hi>: Sturnus vulgaris, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 24, 35, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:160" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 17, 45, § 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:120" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 42, 59, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:55:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 55, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:4:18" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stygialis: <entryFree id="n45688" type="main" key="Sty^gi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stygĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Styx, II. 2.</entryFree>
stygius: <entryFree id="n45689" type="main" key="Sty^gi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stygĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Styx, II. 1.</entryFree>
stylobates: <entryFree id="n45690" type="greek" key="sty^lo^ba^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stylŏbătes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">stylŏbăta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stuloba/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n45690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the pedestal of a column</hi> or <hi rend="ital">row of columns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stylobate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:11 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 11 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:13:3" default="NO">1, 13, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stylus: <entryFree id="n45691" type="main" key="sty^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stylus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. stilus.</entryFree>
stymma: <entryFree id="n45692" type="greek" key="stymma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stymma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stu/mma</foreign>, <sense id="n45692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chief ingredient</hi> or <hi rend="ital">foundation of an unguent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:3:17" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 3, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stymphalus: <entryFree id="n45693" type="main" key="Stympha_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stymphālus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stymphā-lum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stu/mfalos</foreign>, <sense id="n45693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district in Arcadia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a town</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mountain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and lake of the same name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated in fable as the haunt of a species of odious birds of prey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very vexatious to the inhabitants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but which were finally destroyed by Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:Ter. 5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. Ter. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:100" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 6, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:298" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 4, 298</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Idyll. 2, 1</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stymphala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 30</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n45693.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stymphālĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Stymphalus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Stymphalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45693.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stym-phālĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Stymphalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 113</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45693.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stymphālis</orth> (scanned Stymphălis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 19, 5</bibl>), ĭdis, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Stymphalus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Stymphalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 187</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:273" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 273</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 227</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 585</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 20" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:30" default="NO">30</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 300</bibl>. —Called, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stymphalides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:102:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 102, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2</bibl>, prooem. 37.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 422" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 422</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 849 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Agam. 849 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
styphelus: <entryFree id="n45694" type="main" key="Sty^phe^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Styphĕlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Centaur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 459</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stypsis: <entryFree id="n45695" type="main" key="stypsis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stypsis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">stipsis</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stu/yis</foreign>, <sense id="n45695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the contracting power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tendency</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <trans><tr>astringency</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 4</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 1, 1</bibl>, as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
stypteria: <entryFree id="n45696" type="greek" key="stypte_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">styptērĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stupthri/a</foreign>, <sense id="n45696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">alum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:9:3:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 9, 3, § 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> <cb n="SUAD" /></sense></entryFree>
stypticus: <entryFree id="n45697" type="greek" key="stypti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">styptĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">stuptiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n45697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">astringent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">styptic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 13, 73, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 9, 36, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <trans><tr>of an acid taste</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oct. 14, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
styrax: <entryFree id="n45698" type="greek" key="sty^rax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">styrax</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">stŏrax</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 33 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 8, 5</bibl>), <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stu/rac</foreign>, <sense id="n45698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tree; and also the resinous gum of that tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">storax</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 55, § 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:24" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 6, 15, § 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 167</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">styrăcĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">made from storax</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
styx: <entryFree id="n45699" type="main" key="Styx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Styx</orth>, <itype>ygis and ygos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stu/c</foreign>. <sense id="n45699.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fountain in Arcadia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the icy-cold water of which caused death</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 231</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:25:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 25, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:14:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 14, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:10:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 10, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45699.1" n="II" level="1"> In mythology, <hi rend="ital">a river in the infernal regions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by which the gods swore</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 480</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 322</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:635" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 635</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:570" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 570</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:30" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Achill. 1, 269 al.</bibl>— Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the infernal regions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the lower world</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 243</bibl>;
