G. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38, 9</bibl> Dietsch ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub furcam ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub divum rapere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 18, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub terras ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 654</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub judicium sapientis et delectum cadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 18, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sub sensus subjecta sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sub aurium mensuram aliquam cadat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:20:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columbae Ipsa sub ora viri venere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sub oculos venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with verb of rest: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid sub Noton et Borean hominum sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 364</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45746.11" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (cf. supra, I. A. 2.), of lofty objects, to the foot of which, or into whose immediate neighborhood, any thing comes, or near to which it extends, <hi rend="ital">under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi> <cb n="SUBA" /> <hi rend="ital">to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">up to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">towards</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub montem succedunt milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub ipsum murum fons aquae prorumpebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:41" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missi sunt sub muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Judaei sub ipsos muros struxere aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes suas detulit sub Veliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arat finem sub utrumque colonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactatus amnis Ostia sub Tusci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hostem) mediam ferit ense sub alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub orientem secutus Armenios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45746.12" n="B" level="2"> Of time, denoting a close approximation. </sense><sense id="n45746.13" n="1" level="3"> Before, <hi rend="ital">towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shortly before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">up to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">until</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius sub noctem naves solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 28</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sub noctem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:662" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 662</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 169</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub vesperum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub lucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 445</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub lumina prima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub tempus edendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub dies festos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub galli cantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque sub extremum brumae intractabilis imbrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra Visa sub obscurum noctis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima vel autumni sub frigora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (bellum) fuit sub recentem pacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45746.14" n="2" level="3"> After, <hi rend="ital">immediately after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub eas (litteras) statim recitatae sunt tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub haec dicta omnes procubuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub adventum praetoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 15, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 10, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub hanc vocem fremitus variantis multitudinis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub hoc erus inquit,</quote> <trans><tr>hereupon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45746.15" n="C" level="2"> In other relations, in which a coming under any thing may be conceived: <cit><quote lang="la">lepide hoc succedit sub manus negotium,</quote> <trans><tr>comes to hand</tr>, <tr>convenient</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub manus succedere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 1, 2</bibl>: sub manum submittere, <hi rend="ital">at hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convenient</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 36, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">sub ictum venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub manum annuntiari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 49</bibl></cit> (al. sub manu; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">supra, I. C.): sub legum et judiciorum potestatem cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:55:section=144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 55, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub populi Romani imperium dicionemque cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 5, 12</bibl></cit> (1, 2): <cit><quote lang="la">incolas sub potestatem Atheniensium redigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonium vos sub legis superbissimae vincula conicitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub unum fortunae ictum totas vires regni cadere pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45746.16" n="III" level="1"> In composition, the <hi rend="ital">b</hi> remains unchanged before vowels and before <hi rend="ital">b</hi>, <hi rend="ital">d</hi>, <hi rend="ital">j</hi>, <hi rend="ital">l</hi>, <hi rend="ital">n</hi>, <hi rend="ital">s</hi>, <hi rend="ital">t</hi>, <hi rend="ital">v.</hi> Before <hi rend="ital">m</hi> and <hi rend="ital">r</hi> it is frequently, and before the remaining consonants, <hi rend="ital">c</hi>, <hi rend="ital">f</hi>, <hi rend="ital">g</hi>, <hi rend="ital">p</hi>, it is regularly assimilated. Yet here the MSS. vary, as in <hi rend="ital">ob</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, etc. Before some words commencing with <hi rend="ital">c.</hi> <hi rend="ital">p</hi>, <hi rend="ital">t</hi>, it assumes the form <hi rend="ital">sus</hi>, by the rejection of the <hi rend="ital">b</hi> from a collateral form subs (analog. to abs); e. g. suscipio, suscito, suspendo, sustineo, sustuli, sustollo. Before <hi rend="ital">s</hi>, with a following consonant, there remains merely <hi rend="ital">su</hi> in the words suspicio, suspicor, suspiro; cf., however: substerno, substituo, substo, substruo al.; v. esp. Neue, Formenl. 2, 775 sqq.—</sense><sense id="n45746.17" n="B" level="2"> In composition, sub denotes, </sense><sense id="n45746.18" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, a being situated or contained under, a putting or bringing under, or a going in under any thing: subaeratus, subcavus; subdo, subigo, subicio; subhaereo, subaperio; subedo.—</sense><sense id="n45746.19" n="2" level="3"> Hence, also, a concealing or being concealed behind something; a secret action: subnoto, surripio, suffuror, subausculto, suborno. —</sense><sense id="n45746.20" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, a being placed or ranked under: subcenturio, subcurator, subcustos, etc.; or a being or doing any thing in a lower or inferior degree, <hi rend="ital">a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slightly</hi>: subabsurdus, subagrestis, subalbus, etc.; subaccusare, subirascor, etc.</sense></entryFree>
